label: Positive

Comments: Stayed here as we met relatives there for a reunion. Thought we’d treat ourselves as we had heard the hype about this place. This place was an absolute nightmare. Booked on their website for a family of four. Arrived to find essentials 2 tiny double beds for 4 people. My husband spoke to reception about the fact that it was not suitable for 4 people, even though the website recommended it for 4 people. They eventually agreed to bring up a fold out bed. But it took hours and multiple requests for it to arrive.   The famous pool up top was absolutely freezing! I didn’t swim in it once! One is the spas was closed too. So the one tiny spa that was there held about 10 bodies in essentially an over sized bath tub. It was so gross.   There was nothing to do here for families.  Only the…
label: Negative

Comments: Provided we got the cheapest room at only $500 a night...it was just your run of the mill standard, nice motel room. Our balcony was genuinely about 20cms wide but was still nice to have a breeze. But let’s get to the reason we chose to stay here...THAT pool. Honestly it is amazing. We visited the pool directly after check in (which is supposed to be 3pm but they told us our room was ready at 2pm which was great!), again that night quite late (it shuts at 11pm), and then in the morning around 7am (it opens at 6am but is still dark then). The best time was the early morning. Less crowded and an all round nicer experience. Don’t get me wrong, STILL quite crowded but nothing on the afternoon and evening. There are photographers in the pool too who will clear a shot for you which is…
label: Neutral

Comments: The Skypark and swimming pool and hot jacuzzi pools with a great view, wow! The view from the rooms wow! If you get one that faces a view. We had one that faces the marina and watched the light show from there. The 5 to 7pm free cocktail is great, do not miss it. Free Teatime 2 to 4 pm is ok. Breakfast is ok. If you drive in valet parking is cheaper and more convenient. Worth at least 1 visit for us locals but very crowded, should do weekdays instead of weekends. Obviously doing very well.
label: Positive

Comments: This hotel, it’s enormous. I thought seeing as I was only in Singapore for a short time I would splurge. For once in a lifetime, totally worth it. I had a beautiful view of the harbour and gardens, absolutely breathtaking. The infinity pool gets quite busy, if you go first thing at 6am definitely less so. It’s right in the middle of many Singapore attractions so on a short stay it’s brilliant. Expensive and busy, but this place is worth the hype.
label: Positive

Comments: Well, I saw pics..thought, yeah right. This was more than yeah right, fantastic hotel, stunning city, lovely people..and I don’t like cities or people! You have to visit/stay here...add to your bucket list ..NOW! Tx
label: Positive

Comments: What a great hotel! Friendly staff, quick check in and check out procedure. They even upgraded us to a better room. Highly recommend this hotel (even if it's just for use of the best swimming pool) The only downside was you need your room key to access the pool toilets which was a bit annoying.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here for a few days stop-over on route to Australia. Good location, big resort style hotel. Check in was extremely slow and cumbersome. It is a very busy place and a tourist attraction in itself. This doesn’t always help the ambience. The oool deck is the taking point. Again, very busy, but people come and go and so we were able to find beds, but not instantly. Food provision, very good. Had an issue over a breakfast charge but it was resolved but not easily. I did have to raise a complaint. Overall, we are glad we stayed. It was enjoyable. It is difficult for these type of hotels to be truly a “luxury” experience when they are so big and busy. I think check in and check out could be made more efficient and management more visible.
label: Neutral

Comments: Amazing amazing amazing! the view just amazing. Stayed at a room facing garden view, it was totally worth it. You get a big balcony overlooking the gardens by the bay which lit up at night. The trip was a surprise birthday present from my partner, surprise cake were arranged after we had our dinner. the lobby is expansive with lots of good dining and small shops, the infinity pool is absolutely amazing and more dining on roof area. Staying in MBS gives loads of perks access to the mall and dining.   Reception staffs are friendly they knew we were looking exhausted gave out complimentary water while checking us in. Process were very quick.   Definitely a place to stay to relax and away from the Orchard Road hustle and bustle. Cleanliness is also awesome, the girl who responsible…
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands is probably what makes singapore super famous. However, the hotel rooms are small and very expensive. People go there definitely just want to snap photos at the infinity pool. However, its not worth it. You can find a better priced hotels near orchard road with decent stay.
label: Neutral

Comments: I totally get the appeal of this hotel. The pool on the rooftop is second to none. It is incredible to spend time up there and enjoy the views of the city while in the infinity pool. However this is not an inexpensive hotel and given the rates one must pay and expect significantly better rooms. Wallpaper is coming off in the bathroom there are stains on the wall and I got to bed only to find my comforter full of stains. Of course the issue with the comforter was resolved but it’s hard to understand how the issue was missed.
label: Neutral

Comments: Marina Bay Sands is so iconic! It has the perfect location and the most fabulous views. The rooms are well appointed. We had a balcony overlooking the Gardens by the Bay. The Gardens side is lower price than the city side, but I think the day and night views of the Gardens are so great I'd pay more to stay there. The infinity edge pool on the top of the hotel is AMAZING. We went early in the morning and it wasn't too crowded or too hot. Be sure to get pictures of the pool, over the edge, and the city views. The hotel is very large and I had recently had knee surgery so it was hard to get around. They offered a free wheelchair which was very helpful. The lobby restaurants and room service were both excellent. The Casino is attached to the hotel, but it is a walk. There is also…
label: Positive

Comments: The wow factor starts as you arrive and look up at the 3 towers. Superb views looking over the gardens or the bay. The pool and the bars/restaurants have superb views.staff are really polite and helpful and can’t do enough to help.
label: Positive

Comments: Read all the reviews and would agree this is a must stay once in your lifetime hotel, and we have taken advice from reading Trip Advisor contributions and are stating 2 nights and 3 days. 2500 rooms is 5000 guests, so don’t come here and expect it to be cosy, come with open eyes and an open mind. We arrived early, room wasn’t ready but was given access to the Skypark, infinity pool and club 55. Fantastic customer support. Emailed when the room was ready, wife stayed in Club 55 I got the keys, shown a Sands Club line, given a bottle of water as I waited. Thank you, fantastic customer support. Our room is fantastic, an Orchid Suite and the view over Marina Bay. A must see in your lifetime
label: Positive

Comments: We came here the last night of our Singapore trip to try the pool. The lobby is immense I felt somwhow lost in it, The check in went well, but I always had the feeling waiting for ages for the elevators. My mum mentioned it is like a big train station and she was right. The service was efficient but faceless, In the lobby area there was no place to sit down and relax, which I found it strange and odd.  The place is crowded, we went to have breakfast at 6:30  but here were already so many people there, I could not believe it. The pool has amazing views but it was crowded as well in the afternoon we could hardly find free sunbeds. The waters is cold, and if you go to the jacuzzi it is way too hot and I am convinced they do it on pourpse!! Our room was okay with a nice view on the…
label: Neutral

Comments: To go up to the top we took advantage of the Ce La Vi bar, were it costs 22SGD to enter the bar. It has fantastic views on which your entry goes towards a free drink plus the tax. To go up to the observation deck it’s the same price, which is only a few steps down from the bar. No brainer really to go to the bar and get your drink that’s included in your ticket price.
label: Positive

Comments: Hotel is beautiful and clean. The infinity pool is the best thing about the hotel. Once you check out you cannot go to the swimming pool area which seems crazy as check out is early (11am). Our flight was not until much later that night so we had to go to the shopping center across the road for the day. Paid $25 for a cocktail that came half full.
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed for one night in order to experience the infinity pool. The whole experience was unenjoyable. The hotel is badly designed. Too big, lacks personality, no personal service at all. You are just another number being shipped in and out of this vast cavern. Infinity pool has a good view but that is it. Overcrowded, no beds available. Cold pool. Rude guests. Everyone is stressed out ! There are sporadic nice staff that are friendly but they seem to be beaten down by the atmosphere. A lot of miserable security staff. Wouldn’t return if someone paid me.
label: Neutral

Comments: WOW! this hotel goes above and beyond to make you feel like complete royalty! the pool us out of this world! its a little chilly up there so bring your robe, but the water is  perfect! we also had breakfast on the 57th floor in the morning and it was wonderful! definitely worth it. i highly recommend this hotel
label: Positive

Comments: A fabulous hotel, albeit massive! Went to the Cest la Vie restaurant to watch the Chinese New Year light show and fireworks. Register for Sands membership (free) for free entry . Entrance through the hotel for Gardens by the Bay
label: Positive

Comments: We arrived from the airport and had to join a long queue for check in.  To fair the queue went down quite quickly but not really what you expect for that money.  We were allocated a room in Tower 3 and we requested a bay view and a high floor and that is what we got.  We were early for check in but the check in clerk advised us 'we looked tired' so we could have our room early....not sure if I was instuled or pleased to get our room early. Room was lovely but nothing special but great views and really good a night when everything start to get lit up. We were there in chinese new year....bad mistake so the pool was just overrun by people.  We had a dip in it but to be honest the pool was quite cold. The lifeguards are excellent and quite quickly blow the whistle at idiots who…
label: Neutral

Comments: A wonderfully iconic hotel with over 2,500 rooms, which shows when you try to move around.  Fantastic staff who do a wonderful job - the room service and concierge service was excellent but for that price, I want impeccable in everything.  Unfortunately, it was Chinese New Year when we were there, so the 57th floor rooftop swimming pool was almost standing room only; but now been there, done that, got the photo.  Prices are room only and we found it cheaper and less stressful to have room service breakfast, which was excellent and delivered bang on time - TIP - choose a city view room as breakfast by a picture window on the 40th floor was stunning.  Easy walking around the harbour and also the magnificent Gardens by the Bay.
label: Positive

Comments: Room was clean and spacious. We got the garden view which was lovely and very beautiful at night. Staffs are very friendly and helpful.    However, we had a terrible time during check-in (13 Feb 2019). We arrived at 1.30pm and was hoping that we can check-in earlier. But when we saw the queue at least 30 people in front of us, we asked one of the staff which he suggested us to come back later in the afternoon as their system was  down. At 2.50pm we came back and saw the queue at the Tower 1 was ridiculously long until it reached the entrance door! So we had to go to the Tower 3 and it was more than an hour wait till we get to the check-in counter. We got to the check-in counter at 4.10pm and finally entered our room at 4.20pm and the luggage arrived 30 minutes after.  The…
label: Neutral

Comments: The room crew was very rude to ignore our requests. My daughter wanted to have extra pillow but was denied and the crew banged the door after room service. Was expecting better treatment as the payment charged is not a joke at all.
label: Negative

Comments: This was a very plush hotel. The infinity pool is jaw dropping. A short walk from the marina with amazing views and restaurants. I am vegan and found it a little difficult in the hotel but a short walk round the corner found a Gordon Ramsay with a full vegan menu option. There is a mall on the ground full of beautiful shops and cafés. The bars are fairly expensive but I suppose you expect this in a luxury venue. The room we had was garden view and man, what a garden. The botanical gardens are right outside and at night looked magical. Thoroughly recommend this hotel, you must get in that pool, cold as it is. The photographers are there on call but there are beds around the pool you can rest your phone/camera on. Towels are handed out and cocktails are available, as are nibbles.…
label: Positive

Comments: We booked and stayed at a Club King room for 3 nights (as suggested by many on Trip Advisor) - this turned out to be a great decision. The room is spacious and can easily fit 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children). We also had access to the Club55 for breakfast, while there were usually queues at other restaurants.  The view from the room was just simply breathtaking.   The indefinite pool at the top is great but always full - it is difficult to even take a photo without others in it...  No kids club nor any kids playing facilities in the hotel - which was disappointing.
label: Positive

Comments: We had a 2 night stay at the Sands prior to our 12 day cruise to Tokyo.  The hotel was very nice food at Spago's was exceptional.  However, it was very crowded and more like a Vegas experience.  Which is not bad, just not the place to go for a relaxing quiet stay.  Rooms were very nice, staff generally friendly.  Long lines for most things like breakfast and the roof top pool area.  Overall worth a visit once I think.
label: Positive

Comments: As we all know about Singapore, this building is just a result of what Singapore is all about. Magnificent. I will certainly will be back and this time I will make sure I will have a chance to swim in their infinity pools
label: Positive

Comments: While all 5-Star hotels in Asia offer pretty much the same amenities and level of service it’s still worth the experience of staying at Marina Bay sands.  The hotel itself is a tourist attraction with as many shops and restaurants as you can imagine.  The views are stunning from everywhere, we stayed in a garden view suite which had a lovely patio where we could enjoy morning breakfast overlooking the Gardens by the bay.   The pool is crowded but still worth it to get the perfect picture of you at the infinity pool!
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed in a standard  double room, which I was suprised the rooms are very big. Bathroom come with a deep bathtub and a large shower. The rooms are presented very well. View to marina bay was unreal! Gym facilities are below average considering this is meant to be a five star hotel, they need more weights equipment. The pool area on the 15th floor is very busy but the view is breathtaking. Don’t bother swimming because everyone is here for a selfie. The pool is not deep, so you can swim around with your camera. This hotel is very busy and so when I checked in I had to pay $400 Singapore dollars for a deposit then was told when I checked out I will get my deposit 2 weeks later?! They need better training of the front desk with customer service skills. I think next time I visit…
label: Negative

Comments: Place is elegant and luxurious. Been here for a 1 day conference and the conference halls are quiet good with the lighting and equipments it has. at night was able to witness an awesome show of lights and fountains synchronously moving resulting to a one of a kind show.
label: Positive

Comments: It's an icon. You want to stay there. You need to stay there, so you can get an Instagram photo of you in the pool. And that is a great reason to book a room because only hotel guests can access the pool. However.....this is not a 5-star hotel, despite the 5-star prices. Don't expect Ritz-Carlton/Taj/Peninsula like comfort, accommodations, or service. The Marina Bay is more like a Las Vegas type "five-star" property. Everything was fine, but it's a gigantic place and more an impersonal mega-resort than a luxury hotel. If you have never been to Singapore (we had not), it's almost a must. But on your second trip, book a more comfortable hotel at half the price elsewhere......assuming you were able to take that infinity pool pic the first time.
label: Neutral

Comments: Let's be real here.  If it's your first time in Singapore, there is no point in staying anywhere else because if you do you will always stare up in envy at this iconic hotel and wonder what it's like to chill out in that ridiculous infinity pool on top--which you can ONLY do if you stay at this hotel.  I booked the MBS before I booked my flight because if I couldn't stay there I wasn't going to Singapore.  Very few places live up to the hype, but the top of the MBS does big time.  It was more spectacular than I imagined.  When we went the weather was iffy the whole time and we had more than our share of rain/thunderstorms.  I was stressing that we wouldn't be able to swim but during our whole 4 day stay they only closed it once for 30 minutes due to lightning.    Yes, this place…
label: Positive

Comments: The structure itself is amazing with the 3 towers capped off with a huge infinity pool. There are gardens near here that are absolutely amazing. The inside of the lobby was massive with several eating areas. The food was rather expensive but good.
label: Positive

Comments: And also the most expensive!  Since I was only going to stay one night, why not go all out.  So, I plunked down over $500 USD for a Harbor view room on the 2nd to the top floor in the hotel.  Lower floor rooms on the Gardens By the Bay side are cheaper. Still, everyone goes for the iconic rooftop infinity pool (the highest in the world) and any stay grants you access. And of course you must visit the pool, but be prepared to act like a shark circling it's prey in order to get a coveted lounge chair.  We were outmaneuvered a couple of times but finally got our chairs!  Our room was absolutely amazing and HUGE!  With a seperate desk and seating area, my whole family could have lived in that room.  What I liked most about the room were the floor to ceiling windows that gave us an…
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed for two days at the end of a cruise and just wish we could have stayed longer we loved it  The roof top pool is something quite special although a little cold  , the views are staggering  Do not miss the light show in the gardens at the rear of the hotel which you can walk to from the hotel  This hotel has everything there is a shopping mall attached so you can simply walk down to the shops  Do not miss this !
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here in April 2018. We were upgraded by the lovely woman on the desk as it was our anniversary. The room was spotless and absolutely gorgeous. We had the best view over Singapore and honestly could not have asked for anything more. The infinity pool and the service from the staff were also second to none! Don’t have a bad word to say about Marina Bay Sands and can’t wait to come back!!
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the MBS in April 2018 with my two year old daughter. This was part of our trip we also stayed a few days on Sentosa Island. The MBS check in procedure is a bit hectic with long queues. There wasn't really any where to so I was glad to have had our pushchair. The lobby is vast and full of people, far too busy you didn't know who were tourists and who were residents. Once checked in we made our way to our room on the 18th floor overlooking the Marina Bay Gardens which was fabulous. The room was clean and spacious and the bathroom had a separate bath and shower the bath in particular was luxuriously big. The main reason we booked to stay here one night was the pool to be brutally honest. It really is a fabulous pool, with fabulous views. There were plenty of beds and…
label: Positive

Comments: I don’t even know where to start. As a traveller. I can confirm this the best hotel I have ever stayed so far. Is not because of the infinity pool. is just because customer priority is more important  I took my there for big birthday. On the day of the birthday, she has decided no go swim very early morning which quest stressful to me because I have plan for In-Room Dining for her as big surprised.   I rushed to their big washroom to quickly send email with subject "urgent” to change the time of In-Room dinning because Mrs decided to swim very early on her birthday.  Within 30 minutes of my email I got call that their team is by the door to deliver the surprise.   They deliver all the request included extra eggs and sausage and Birthday “Moet Chandon Imperial Brut” for my…
label: Negative

Comments: I'm really enjoy staying in Marina Bay Sands,especially front deck and concierge very helpful.Pool are really awesome,my friends really enjoy staying in this big hotel.Very near to the flyer and Marina bay Shoppes.Thanks you so much
label: Positive

Comments: The price of this hotel was well above what it should be. The lobby at check in is just a massive scrum of people. Everyone taking photos. Check in took almost 30 mins. Our room had the most spectacular views it has to be said, but it felt tired. I just feel the hotel needs a makeover to bring it into the 2019 era and to match the asking price. But, I guess for most people it’s a chance to ‘check’ themselves in on social media and keep up with the jones’.
label: Neutral

Comments: This hotel was the biggest and the most fantastic hotel I’ve ever had the pleasure of staying. Food , drink staff facilities were second to none . The infinity pool on top level absolutely unbelievable. Worth paying extra money to be in suite 55 area free food and drink certain times of the day was plentiful and staff were fantastic, definitely worth a visit
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for 1 night before our cruise during the Christmas holiday. The lobby holiday decor was beautiful. Check-in was smooth, the room was very clean, comfortable, and the view was great. We at brunch at the lobby restaurant and the food was amazing. Something from every part of the world on the menu. Overall, I just wish I had more time to spend at the Marina Bay Sands. The pool view is breathtaking. If you're thinking about visiting this resort, go for it! It's worth it.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina bay sands is famous for its sky pool  I had an amazing stay in the hotel In the lobby entrance there is always a Lamborghini or Ferrari  and you can rent it too for few hundred dollar , their rates are more expensive compared to in France so I skipped that the room is also very luxury You need a room key to be able to access the floors of the hotel room so your privacy is very much valued in this hotel  Follow me on instagram @charzmoritz for more luxury content and collaboration inquiries
label: Positive

Comments: A must in Singapore!  Obviously a landmark as well as a stunning architecture masterpiece.  The rooms are clean and well appointed.  The bay side is worth price because of the view at night and day.  So much to do you can get lost in the hotel!  Plus great restaurants to chose from.  Check in on line and save the line!
label: Neutral

Comments: This is the best hotel I've ever seen, the service is at the height, quality materials in the rooms. Very cool view from the roof of the hotel. It's unforgettable.From the height of the hotel is visible all of Singapore.
label: Positive

Comments: Awsome view! Awsome Infinity pool. It is really central, so u can get anywhere u want pretty fast. The hotel is okay, construction and architecture is not really high quality, its more for attract tourist people.  But a must one!
label: Positive

Comments: This is a 5-star hotel, but we found the property just couldn't handle crowds. There were multiple choke points around the property, most noticeably at the elevators, where you'd sometimes wait for multiple full elevators to go by. Or, wait times in general and massive cattle herding. For the price, this was a let down.  The room was fantastic, however we found little annoyances - the TV remote did not work, the window shade motor bugged out every time we activated the room power, and the mandarins they gave us has big mold spots. So, not perfect.  The Club 55 staff are superb - so personable. Shout out to Gina!
label: Neutral

Comments: We came here for one night and I must say it was a great disappointment for the amount of money we spent.   The hotel is a great looking iconic feature of Singapore and it has the world famous rooftop infinity pool. That’s where it ends.   Negatives:  1.The lobby is like a market place - noisy and crowded. There is nowhere to sit and relax eg while waiting for someone.   2.The check in and check out is atrocious- service is absolutely slow and understaffed. For a hotel of this reputation and standard I do not expect to be standing in line to check in for over 20 minutes.   3. The room is a standard size hotel room and is nothing special. For the cheapest room here we paid over £360 for 1 night! We have stayed in much better hotels in Singapore for a lot less than half that!   4.…
label: Negative

Comments: Even though this is the biggest tourist destination in Singapore, the service level is high, the options for eating, drinking and shopping endless, and of course the rooftop pool is one the coolest in the world.
label: Positive

Comments: Had a wonderful stopover at the Marina Bay. The room was beautiful, with an incredible view (we'd been upgraded from the ground floor, which was lovely). The staff were amazing. The rooftop pool has a brilliant city view - it's a bit of a selfie-soup, so don't expect to actually be able to swim properly, but the view is stunning. The poolside restaurant did amazing breakfasts and good cocktails (we didn't try any of the other food there).  Everything is ridiculously well organised and particularly liked that when you check out you can use the gym, spa and shower all day, so if you have an evening flight can leave your bags, enjoy the day then come and freshen up.   Singapore in general was a bit of a surprise. We saw it as a stopover and I'd always imagined it to be a bit…
label: Positive

Comments: A beautiful view from the bar and pool area with an almost 360 degree view of Singapore, the pool is for guests only. Drinks very very expensive. There is not much shade and extremely hot and not much seating but well worth a look
label: Neutral

Comments: I’ve been to MBS several times already but only doing the review now maybe because I get used to the hotel already but our last stay this Feb was a superb staycation.  Love the grand club room, plus the high tea, the cocktails and breakfast at club 55. (Will do a separate review at club 55).  The hotel as usual is crowded at the lobby, specially the check in and out counter hope they can do something about this. Good thing club rooms can check in at VIP check in counter.  Hope MBS will continue to have great service and amenities specially the infinity pool.  Will definitely visit MBS when I will be in SG again.
label: Positive

Comments: This amazing hotel is a must when visiting Singapore even if only for one night. We stayed 2 nights and enjoyed everything, especially the infinity pool on the 57th which can only be accessed by guests. It is very busy and we were there for Chinese New Year and it was crowded. Our room 805 in the 3rd Tower was large and very well appointed. Access to the Gardens By The Bay, the shopping mall and the Art/Science Museum was easy. Service everywhere was excellent, cheerful staff were happy to help with everything thing. Our only disappointment was dinner at Lavo, an Italian/American themed restaurant, the service was so quick our meal was served immediately we had ordered which suggested that it was very much prepared, certainly not by a chef and it was very expensive. We were in…
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay sands is a luxurious mall that has cozy cafes/Restaurants to chill. Besides that, not everything in marina bay sands is neither expensive, however there is also certain shops that sells affordable items that fullfill your own personal needs! So don’t forget to visit MBS, Singapore! 😃
label: Positive

Comments: Its been a few years since my last visit at MBS, but seems like nothing has changed, it just got even better. The view from our balcony is awesome facing the garden. Very comfortable beds and nice ambiance. Good food served at the casino. And of course to top it all the  jacuzzi and infinity pool. Yay. I am definitely gonna be back.  😍😍😍
label: Positive

Comments: I have stayed in other hotels in Singapore  - Raffles, Hyatt and Shangri-la. By far this is mt favorite. Great views, close to the gardens and best of all, the best hawkers market at the lower level - try the hand pulled noodles. The view at the top floor is the best in the city, We dined at Ce La Vi one night - the food was great.
label: Positive

Comments: Visited yesterday mid afternoon . No question and fantastic views from the viewing platform . Well worth a visit . The shopping mall below has everything you could wish for . Foodhall dussapointing though .
label: Positive

Comments: If you want to stay in an architectural icon roughly on par with .....oh i dont know.....the Colosseum! this is your place. The building, itself, has become THE symbol of Singapore. Its bustling night and day and  if tranquility is what you're after this might not be the place for you. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Marina Bay Sands,  We had a package which allowed us private check-in. This alone, made it worth it after a 15 or 16 hour flight. . We had our choice of breakfast at 3 or 4 different places - we tried a different one every day.  We also had exclusive access to a Club room which we utilized a few times, but not every day. Our suite was nice but not luxurious. More like a business class hotel.  The bathroom was VERY nice.  Big, dual sinks, enormous walk-in shower and…
label: Positive

Comments: We totally splurged to be able to say we stayed here. Only one night but it was amazing!!  Staff was Uber friendly. Room was gorgeous. We chose a view of the city and at night we watched the light show from the room. By far the best part is the infinity pool. Hard to want to go anywhere else! Food prices are high as well as wine. But we knew this was a one time deal so we indulged. Our girls LOVED it. Would do it all again in a heartbeat.
label: Positive

Comments: As someone being a guest from outside, 20 dollar per person entry must be paid, which you can use for a drink. It was the most amazing view what I have seen until now. Nice bar, I would love to come back once.
label: Neutral

Comments: Architecture buildings here are one of the best in Asia. High end fashion brands easily found here. You name it, they’ve got it all. The staffs were very friendly. Nice place for family with teenagers getaway. Love to come back here in future
label: Positive

Comments: We decided to stay in that hotel because of infinity pool. But the true is that is a massive hotel with to much people:( the rooms are ok, but not so special for the price. The pool - to many people making photos. For sure it is not a place for holiday. Just to go for swimingpool for 20 minutes and make pictures.  The hotel is also not so new.  But we have to be there to have our own opinion.
label: Neutral

Comments: We came to Marina Bay Sands with high expectations. Overall it was not a pleasant visit. Firstly the checkin was overcrowded and took 20 to get to the front of the line. The hotel is know for its roof top pool, unfortunately it was overcrowded with  people taking selfies.  The water was dirty.  The hotel seemed overcrowded with people. The only place that was good was the room, it was a refuge from all the noise and crowds.
label: Neutral

Comments: The best Hotel in Singapour. Famous for the roof-top infinity pool. Room was super with a nice  view  of the bay  Personnel is costumer oriented. A large selection of restaurant is available. Do not miss it if you are in this area.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here for a couple of nights, of course to experience the luxury hotel and famous infinity pool. The hotel is stunning, the rooms are beautiful, spacious and balcony is huge. The terrace area with bars, restaurants and the pool is amazing. Saying all that, we were disappointed with the lack of assistance from staff. They are just way too busy to be of help. We tried to get into the Ce La Vi club on the upper level and was told that tickets were sold out. The doorman was extremely rude! We chose to go elsewhere and found out on the ground floor that tickets were being sold for the club entry!
label: Neutral

Comments: We came, we saw we thought “ho hum”. We have been in Singapore for two weeks and have looked over the bay several times thinking gotta do that.  Now we are here not so much. If you are going to lay down $650 US for a room here be prepared for a sub standard experience. Room are nice but small for the $. Yes the pool is great and the view 5 star, its the screaming kids and parents that spoil the show. And the selfie gang, don’t get me started. So if we had to do over, spend a couple of hundred less on different 5 star hotel, or if your determined to spend the $650 per night, you can rent a whole sweet at say the inter continental hotel and get the service that should come with that price point. Oh and no breakfast that’s extra, also instant coffee in the room, really folks no…
label: Negative

Comments: right out of the plane I was supported and greeted by a hostess who drove me to the driver. the hotel is impressive i had a perfect warm and professional welcome despite the world. My room was beautiful with a marvelous view of the bay, perfect for the sound and light show. Room service was excellent. The real plus was of course the rooftop pool! impressive! The hotel is next to the Garden Bay Marina. The staff is very attentive and discreet. The breakfast was a full and excellent buffet. If you are going to Singapore this is the hotel not to miss and by far the best!
label: Positive

Comments: Unfortunately visited here as a multiple sight seeing tour.  It would have been lovely to spend some time up there but as we only had half an hour allocated by the tour company and the queue for the lift back down  was 20 minutes then we only had time to take a few pictures before our decent .  Fabulous views, recommend you allow plenty of time and do this venue independently.
label: Positive

Comments: I was in Singapore for only 48 hours as a stopover on the way from Australia to the UK. I felt like this hotel was a must do, although mega pricey! We arrived around 10am and started to queue for check-in, it was very busy and quite slow like many of the reviews on here have said. The staff definitely seemed aware of this though and we were taken through to the VIP check-in to speed things along. As check in isn't until 3pm we were told our room wasn't ready but we were given temporary key cards to be able to access the pool area and we told we would be emailed when our room was ready. This was fine for us as our plan was to get out ASAP to see the city.  There is a hop on hop off bus stop right outside the hotel which was ideal for us as we wanted to see as much as possible and…
label: Neutral

Comments: Marina Bay was an amazing experience. We stayed here for 10 days and really enjoyed everything they had to offer. We loved that our suite opened the windows automatically with great view to the city. You can chose your view to be either garden or river/city. I recommend booking in advance to have breakfast on the top floor. Its amazing and delicious! The missing star is because is SO BIG, SO CROWDED that you feel as if you're in a theme park in Orlando, Fl. The swimming pool is nice during sunset, amazing view. The cocktail bar on top was so fun. The restaurants were so good. All in all, amazing place to sta
label: Positive

Comments: Great hotel with all facilities. We had a city view room which looked out over the harbour. Amazing! But it was the Chinese New Year, so this hotel was full. We went up to the rooftop pool but it was full of Chinese taking selfies. We came back down quite quickly . The photos look wonderful of this rooftop pool and gardens but choose your time to go!
label: Neutral

Comments: Very beautiful Hotel by the bay.  Has a huge shopping complex with world's best brands.  Don't forget to visit the light show in bay behind the hotel building at night.
label: Positive

Comments: Such a pity because I enjoyed the hotel rooms and all the surrounding amenities, but the treatment we received from the pool and security staff put a huge stain on our whole experience at the Marina Bay Sands. IMO, if a person pays extra $$ to get 2x nicer rooms for 5 star luxury (as promised), then maybe the hotel should invest in training their staff to provide 5 star customer service or at least teach them reasonable dispute resolution skills. Upon check-in (with a family of 5 AND 2 elderly grand parents) we were advised that our 2x booked rooms could not be adjoined and that only one room was available to us, forcing a 2 hr wait for the 2nd room to open up. That was not a problem for us as we understood how busy MBS was at the time, so we happily accepted their offer of…
label: Negative

Comments: We arrived at 9am after a 10 hour flight, I expected to checkin in the afternoon as most hotels do, we only waited 30 minutes to get our room, which was spectacular! We booked a garden view room, we got one on the 30th floor, at the end of the hallway, meaning we had views of the gardens AND the Bay! The infinity pool was as spectacular as we had imagined, the service at this hotel was prompt and excellent! I would definitely stay here again!  The New Year’s eve party at Lavo was a bit chaotic at first (rather go watch the fireworks at the pool) but after midnight it got so much better, we had lots of fun!
label: Neutral

Comments: The reception area of this hotel can be like central station but we had no problem after being chaperoned to VIP check in, immediately on arrival. Nice touch folks. We booked into a Garden View King on L30 and our room was marvellous.  Sleek, contemporary and spotless. A great entry foyer and a large bathroom are a highlight as is the great view over the Gardens By The Bay area. If you like a city view then go right ahead. With this you get the free light show on the wharf side of the hotel. Expensive?  Yes but you do get your money's worth. A dip in the Infinity pool is a must but I have to say it is quite crowded. The dining offerings are spread out all over the place which is a bit of a draw back but our breakfasts at Bread Street (Gordon Ramsey) were the highlight. When in…
label: Positive

Comments: While this hotel is quite pricey, everyone who pays a visit to Singapore needs to stay in this hotel at least once. The pool is one of it's highlights and definitely lives up to its reputation. A beautiful way to spend the afternoon overlooking the Singapore skyline and enjoying the amenities and blissfulness of the pool area. The main criticism is the menu in the pool area needs a lot of improvement, and while you expect a place like this to be overpriced, the prices really were over the top for what you get, and the service was below average. The breakfast next to the pool area was another highlight however, great selection of foods to please almost anyone, with a pleasant ambience to start the day. We stayed in one of the suites which was very spacious and comfortable with…
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands was an epitome of modern architecture in Singapore A showcase indeed! Amenities were just beyond your reach! From world class restaurants, casinos,close by shops and tourist attraction spots! All in one area!  And when you are tired with all the activities you can use the pool with a view of the ciity and just relax along the pool sipping  your Singapore Sling drink in your hand! This is it for a total vacation!
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed at the inconic Marina Bay Sands during a short stop over in Singapore, in an executive room with a view of the harbour.  When we arrived, the staff were extremely friendly and very welcoming. Just what the doctor ordered after a long flight.  Our room; very spacious and a wonderful view of the harbour and the gardens. Benefiting from a higher floor, the views were all the better.   The pool area at night makes for a great phot opportunity, with a lovely back drop of the city and the infinity pool. Quite cold, but definitely worth a dip.
label: Positive

Comments: Expensive, but worth a couple night's stay to enjoy the pool and views from the rooftop.  We had breakfast at SPAGO, although the food was good, there wasn't much variety for vegetarians.    Staff is friendly, as you would expect from a hotel of this caliber.  The check-in process took a bit of time as there was a long queue, they made up for it by upgrading our room for free and allowing us to check in early.  Definitely take a walk around the hotel outside, it looks quite nice from all angles, especially from Gardens by the Bay.   The train station is right across the street so location is very convenient.  But most places within the city center are walkable.
label: Positive

Comments: The Marina Bay Sands hotel is a fantastic place to stay in Singapore. It's located at the centre of the city, 5 minutes taxi ride from the cruise terminal. I've stayed twice, both times staff were fantastic, room was immaculate, modern, fun. The hotel itself had a really nice coffee shop called sweet spot at the bottom of tower 3. When you stay you've automatic access to the infinity pool on the roof, which is fantastic! There's nice restaurants and shops attached and easy access to the gardens etc. A great place to stay
label: Positive

Comments: We decided to splurge for a one day stay at this hotel post-cruise.  We arrived at 9 AM and our requested room type (Grand Club) was not ready but we were given a pass to use the pool area and were told that we would get an email when the room was ready.  No problem because we were heading off to meet up with friends to explore the city so we checked our luggage.  When we were arrived back, we were told that we had been upgraded to a 52nd floor Orchid Suite with a garden view.  Oh my, what a lovely room with a separate large living room / desk area, TWO small balconies overlooking Gardens by the Bay and the harbor, and a large bathroom with a huge walk in shower, two sinks, and a tub.  There were multiple universal plug outlets and USB ports for charging.  And the bellman even…
label: Positive

Comments: It’s the best hotel in Singapore we love this hotel very much !!! Good location good views and have many thing to do here !!! Easy to getting around Singapore the food here so amazing and service was wonderful too !!! You can walk everywhere from here as well !!! Of course Singapore are very safe and clean country!!
label: Positive

Comments: It was a small dream or a big wish to stay in MBS.. Finally I achoeved it & how... On a solo trip, though with my 2.7yo daughter. Well, this beautiful hotel was all that I wanted on this trip.... Pure luxury.  Coming to the hotel, the check in was smooth & quick... Accompanied by a nice welcome drink. The staff helped me to the room... To my surprise, I was given a written apology for a delay of may be 4-5 mins in sending my luggage. The room was lavish & the view was spectacular. I was on the 35th floor of Tower 3... Well connected & the elevator to the infinity pool is in the same tower.  Food was amazing & of course, the service impeccable. One of the best breakfast buffets I have had. The view from the observation deck & pool were worth everything. The lill daughter had a…
label: Positive

Comments: Amazing hotel. check in was quick and easy. As we queued we were handed a small bottle of water, a nice touch. Our room was spacious and super clean.  The city view is the more expensive view but I’d been to Singapore 🇸🇬 before and I wanted the garden view.  Very beautiful.  The room was great. A couple of little niggles but they were so small they’re not worth a mention. The staff are wonderfully attentive. The place is huge and can be a little confusing at times but there’s always someone to ask. We ate there a few times and the food was exceptional. The pool is busy but is something you MUST do, even if it’s just to take a photo. The views from the top are mesmerising and having a cheeky cocktail or two makes it all the more special. I would definitely recommend staying…
label: Positive

Comments: A very nice hotel which if you can afford to is worth a visit. There is a lot to do on site. The Infinity Pool is by far the best part and only accessible if staying the night. This can get very busy so visit the pool very early in the morning if you want some nice photos for social media.
label: Positive

Comments: Great 4 nites in a club suite. Staff were very polite and helpful. Our two young boys loved the pool and all the restaurants. Views were amazing. Close to all the good shops and restaurants. We’ll be back for the F1!
label: Positive

Comments: Beautiful hotel with an excellent staff and gorgeous views. The hotel is walking distance to the major attractions and food is delicious. As a guest you will have free access to the observation deck and the infinity pool is really really amazing!
label: Positive

Comments: Really nice hotel with gorgeous view.  You have free excess to the observation deck on top of the hotel, otherwise you have to pay more than 20 dollars to get there.  Also swimming in the roof top pool is really amazing, nice view. It is kind of pricey, but well worth it.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the MBS for a 2 night stay before our cruise.  We took a Grab from the airport ($16SGD)   There are 2 checkin desks.  Tower 1 is the main desk. Checkin was smooth.  We arrived at around noon and were escorted to the VIP Check in area by the conceigre.  We waited about 10 min to checkin.  While a smoking room was available immediately, I cannot stand smoke.  So we waited about an hour for a nonsmoking room.  While you wait, a temporary room card is available to give you access to the pool and gym.  There is also luggage storage that is delivered to your room.    Our room 3757 is in Tower 2.  It was a garden view premier room.  We had a small balcony overlooking the GBTB. Very comfortable. Large bathtub and shower.  The staff makes this 5 stars experience.  They…
label: Neutral

Comments: Amazing experience! Incredible pool, wonderful staff, big and comfortable room, with an amazing view! A lot of restaurants and just a few steps from Gardens by the Bay. The location is very good, you can do everything by foot or by bike. Breakfast in the room is awesome! Highly recommend this Hotel!
label: Positive

Comments: Very good hotel, very good service, great room and an abundance of food available. Not to mentioned the Skygarden and one of the best shopping in the world on your doorstep. This hotel must be done. I would definitely advise upgrading to a room with view on the bay. gym session in the morning also very impressive.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed three nights at Marina Bay Sands last Christmas before we went to Langkawi. We were with another family so we needed 5 rooms. We booked some nice rooms at one of the upper floors so the view is amazing. When we came back from Langkawi we booked a few rooms just for the day, because we didn't want to hang around the airport for a whole day, but those rooms had a different view, to the park, which was beautiful too because the trees in the park are really stunning. It is like a scene from Avatar.  The hotel lobby is crowded and everything is so huge, it's not a hotel you want to stay for more than a few days I guess. But for a couple of days it's great, especially the Skypark with the rooftop swimmingpool, the restaurants and bars.  We had dinner in the different…
label: Positive

Comments: After travelling for a month and staying in hostels I decided to treat myself to two nights at the Marina Bay.   Check in was smooth with no issues, I was able to check into my room a little earlier than 3pm.   The room was fantastic, clean and spacious. The bath tub was amazing!   I ordered room service on the first night, which was very tasty!   The main attraction was of course the infinity pool on floor 57. It was very secure and you could only access it if you had your room key to swipe in and out.   The water was a nice temperature, views were incredible. There is an adult only section which was a bit quieter however the noise levels were not an issue for me personally.   Excellent service through out. Shops, restaurants and attractions to keep you occupied through out…
label: Positive

Comments: yes, it is indeed a bit pricey but the hotel amenities makes the stay worth it! plus the location of the hotel is at the heart of the city so you can easily go around SG. However, although the view at the top was great, i am never satisfied with my infinity pool experience. (I checked in Marina Bay 3x already). There are a LOT of tourists! 😱 You can't really relax anymore. It is too crowded for me. but you have to try it at least once. 🙂
label: Positive

Comments: Did not stay in hotel but enjoyed walking around the hotels and Shoppes. Make sure to get your Lifestyle Marina Sands card for discounts - got us 15% off at Rise sunday lunch, and applies to many venues.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands is an awesome location with an amazing view. From the 40 floor we had an incredible view of the Garden by the Bay especially in the night when everything is lighted. The Marina Promenade is very beautiful as well. The room and the bathroom very clean with an excellent housekeeping service. A very big breakfast variety at Rise Restaurant. Everything was excellent!  Ovidiu
label: Positive

Comments: This is one of those places where you cross off your bucket list and not go again.  Likes: Infinity Pool and Sky Park, clean and spacious rooms, complimentary wi-fi (excellent speeds). Location near Gardens by the Bay, The Shoppes and Marina Bay.  Dislikes: check-in process can be cumbersome with long queues and requirement of ID for ALL guests. Expensive. No cheap food options nearby. Infinity pool is moderately crowded (it's not a canned sardine experience like some people say it is)  Overall recommendation: would recommend but will probably not go again, mostly because it's expensive
label: Positive

Comments: Like a lot of people we booked a room so that we could use the pool. We had a deluxe room on the 19th floor of tower three overlooking the gardens. Fantastic view out of the balcony over the gardens, and views of the sunrise directly in front of the hotel. Being a 5 start hotel it is not cheap, particularly when we stayed, during the lead up to Chinese New Year. We did not eat at any of the restaurants, but did treat ourselves to room service, which while expensive actually provided more food than we were expecting and we struggled to finish what we had ordered, despite how tasty it was.  The pool is open from 6am-11pm and can only be accessed by hotel guests. It is quite popular, but there were always beds available and plenty of free room in the pools to actually swim. They…
label: Positive

Comments: When you pay more than double what other, more highly rated hotels in Singapore cost, I get it that reviews may be mixed. There's no doubt it's an expensive hotel, with a lot of hype and recognition - much like the Burj Khalifa or Eiffel Tower. The views are unmatched.  I've read a couple of lackluster reviews of Club 55 (club lounge available to those who buy club level rooms), but I liked it. The food is NOT amazing, however the service and views make it a great place to visit. It can be crowded, but there are tables with views of either downtown/north or the harbor and gardens to the south. It's only two stories below the infinity pool. I think it's worth getting a club room, which includes breakfast, afternoon tea, and evening canapes.  Our room was on the 10th floor of…
label: Positive

Comments: Once in a lifetime for me; I'm told the 2500 rooms are always full; amazing at the price point!  It is amazing; we were whisked into a VIP line upon entry; uncertain why but happy!  The room with a view of the bay was very clean and well furnished.  My only complaint is that we had been away from home for 3 weeks with lots of luggage.  The furniture doesn't have space to accommodate much clothing.  Be ready for expensive everything.  A glass of wine starts at $25 Singapore dollars and a Singapore sling is $35; meals follow suit.  You can, however, eat in the attached food court.  Don't be horrified!  The food is better than many restaurants in the US.  You can get a bowl of pho for $7. Service is impeccable. The lobby and the pool are very crowded.  At the pool, go to the adult…
label: Positive

Comments: Hotel is very near to airport, approx 15 mins by Taxi, so great location to explore city. Lots of communal areas with shops and a Casino, plus a SkyPark (aka SkyDeck), but we found these and the lobby areas nearly always crowded, with hardly anywhere to sit, so if you are looking for a 5 star hotel with relaxing, quite public areas this one is not recommended. Had to queue for check-in and no welcome drink but room was comfortable (nothing special, more like 4 Star) and spacious, but on sixth floor, opposite the highway, so if you book this floor be prepared for some background road noise. AC a little noisy, but kept room cool. House-keeping excellent and kept room spotless. Room Key-cards can be temperamental so keep away from your mobile phone in pocket or handbag, unless you…
label: Positive

Comments: We recently stayed herein January for 5 nights as a family of four. We stayed in a family room on the lower floors, although we did not have a view our room was really spacious and gorgeous. We all loved this hotel, the pool was amazing, the staff were so thoughtful, facilities were great. We will definitely be back, my advice is stay here if you can, it is pricey but we loved every minute.
label: Positive

Comments: I have stayed at MBS many times before but recently feel that they have upgraded their services which is a good sign. Check in facilities are better than before  and staff is also more friendly Campari to the past
label: Neutral

Comments: Went to Singapore for an overnight trip from Bali. I had only dreamed of visiting this place after watching the Amazing Hotels series on Netflix! It was more amazing than I could have ever dreamed! I split the room with a friend, and we were in awe at our Harbour View room overlooking the Gardens by the Bay! We were on the 46th floor in the 3rd tower, and paid additional money for a higher floor. The breakfast at the RISE restaurant was spectacular - with an amazing buffet spread. The laser light show (we watched from right outside the mall entrance near the Louis Vuitton on it's own island) was AMAZING - one of the best that I have ever seen! And the pool.... oh the pool! I went up with one set of friends in the evening, and then again in the morning with another set of…
label: Positive

Comments: We paid a bit extra for a room high up facing the city. The view was stunning. The rest was not cheap for what it was, but it was memorable. Walking through the lobby was kinda like going to the British Museum, it's just too huge. You don't feel special, you are just a tourist among many hundred other tourists who are posing in the pool, which makes you feel a bit silly perhaps. Still, we had a couple hundred photos of ourselves in the pool to show for it & everyone did love the photos. So I suppose as a one-off it was alright
label: Neutral

Comments: Amazing views and facilities. 15 min from the airport and all the city under you to enjoy it. It is the best hotel I have been in so far. Infinity pool is open from 6:00am up to 23:00pm and it is big enough to avoid massification. Nice one!
label: Neutral

Comments: We had a great time at MBS and its our first time in Singapore. They made sure that we had the best time and offered the best assistance. Our room was very clean and organized. Room service was excellent and all the staff are very friendly and helped us in all we need. We will definitely come back!
label: Positive

Comments: On our tour of 5 top Singapore hotels, the MBS is an iconic building with unparalleled views. Unfortunately this monster of a hotel is disappointing on service by its very size. Service is impersonal, rushed and inefficient. Club 55 is like a cheap airport lounge with bland food. Queues for restaurants are not uncommon with mediocre food.  Room decor is utilitarian.  You’re simply paying for staying in an iconic hotel!
label: Neutral

Comments: Stayed for a night as a family with 2 children (teen & tween). We arrived at the hotel at 7am and requested for a room upgrade and asked if there's enough beds for the 4 us. We got the free room upgrade from garden view to city view with 2 king beds plus early check-in! Winning!!! The room was just perfect. Very spacious, luxurious, clean, comfortable. And the views from the room are just magnificent. We watched the Spectra light & water show from the comfort of our room! And the infinity pool ... this is the main reason we stayed there ... the kids loved it we made sure we utilised it on both days. Such a memorable experience for my family.
label: Positive

Comments: Nice fancy hotel. Room is very nice. Nice views of Gardens by the Bay and on the other side, views of the city skyline.  On the 57th floor you have the infinity pool and the sky park with wonderful views of the city. Infinity pool is only accessible for hotel guests while the sky park , access with a fee. Worth the price.
label: Positive

Comments: Edgaro Reyes went the extra mile in providing superior service! His friendly approach and expert advice added much to our trip and our experience of the city. Individuals who display such professionalism ensure visitors will keep returning. Edgardo is a great ambassador of good will for Singapore!
label: Positive

Comments: Was advised to stay in a Club room which was excellent advice, the extra cost is well well worth it.    The rooms are much bigger and on the high floors (ours on 47th).    On arrival there was a huge queue for the reception check in desks.   Not for club rooms, go straight in to the lounge, have a coffee then all done.   Every morning, huge queues for breakfast.  Not for club rooms, go straight to complementary breakfast on the 55th floor.   Free cocktails and canapes each day too (plus afternoon tea which we didnt try).   Canapes are substantial and drinks keep coming...   Maybe almost enough for dinner.  So the room - well it is clean and tidy and huge.  The downsides.   Well first of all in the bathroom the shower room is huge but rather than fit a rainfall shower it is a…
label: Positive

Comments: we stayed there for a couple of nights. the rooms are wide and spacious and the interior design is modern.  the views are breathtaking and the pool on the 57th floor is just amazing. it gets crowded but we went really early (7.30am) and it was fine. the hotel itself lacks a lobby and with its three separate buildings, it feels sometimes that you are in an airport rather than in a hotel. we went to the Spa which is another highlight of this hotel.
label: Positive

Comments: This Luxurious, Integrated Resort Hotel, cum huge Casino, Restaurants and Conference/Exhibition Centre, and amazing parks also has wonderful "City Views".  It also has incredible "Architectural Features" (including the 340 meter "SkyPark," and the largest "cantilevered/elevated Infinity Swimming Pool").  There are many "High End shoppes  in Marina Bay" and themed restaurants [some bearing the names of famous "Celebrity Chefs"] as well as a "Food Court".  Although the prices reflect the hi-quality amenities, and the 2561 rooms- the "occupancy rates" are always very high (reservations are strongly suggested)!  It has been recognised by TripAdvisor with the "Certificate of Excellence".   Its also worthy of a visit by travellers!     I hope that this Review has been helpful.
label: Positive

Comments: We spent 2 nights in a deluxe city view room inc breakfast. Very impressive hotel, breakfast in the rooftop restaurant is a must.  Yes it’s expensive but a fantastic place to stay. The views are awesome, service is top notch and the rooms are very spacious.
label: Positive

Comments: This was one of the goto in my list and I am glad, I did it and it's worth it! The hotel is huge and lots of stuff to see in and out. The main purpose was to visit the infinite pool. Only thing was, weather wasn't great (raining), I missed the evening time in the pool. So, went to pool early in the morning and there was no crowd but it was lil windy and cold.   If you stay in upper floors you get a nice view and water show (for the city view) in the night and I am glad that I upgraded my room to upper floors.  The hotel is so huge (3 towers) and there are plenty of shops around and they have casinos also. The food court is amazing! I also went to crystal garden and it's very nice.  I was there for short time but it's worth the money for once in lifetime to do.  TIP: Stay in…
label: Positive

Comments: I don’t normally write negative reviews but ......We stayed one night as a family because we were ( like everybody!) intrigued to see the rooftop pool. We paid approx A$800 for one room for one night which is top dollar high end .   It was not worth the price or the effort - the hotel is in my view overly populated and not relaxing. The pool itself is cold and we believe this is deliberate to keep customers from spending too long there . Most patrons take their glamorous selfies in the pool then leave . Tick , been there , done that . I can’t think of a reason to go back but it has extinguished our curiosity . I think the pool is over rated . The view is great but again doesn’t compensate for the lack of chairs & over crowding of the pool area . We struggled to sit together as a…
label: Negative

Comments: Stayed in Tower 1 for 2 nights. It was a good stay. Nice location and excellent service. Did not get the high floor that I requested and a little disappointed with the small chocolate cake sent to my room to celebrate my wedding anniversary Expected a better reward from this luxury hotel. Only negatives were the air conditioning which could not be lowered enough and the bathroom sinks which did not drain well. Had two service calls, before the tv was functioning properly.  Breakfast buffet was great.
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed at tower 3 27th floor with a garden view, the hotel is clean and well maintained. Staff are friendly and always happy to help. The sky deck and infinity pool is an awesome amenities. It is very pricey so maybe book early and avoid busy seasons and it also get over crowded.
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed in the Marina Bay Sands a couple of times and I must say, it never fails to disappoint. Great view, great room and great customer service. I had dropped my belt buckle in the room and couldn't find it and when I made a call to get the room cleaner to double check again, they found it and they sent it up to my room on my next stay.  Visited Club 55 on every stay and I couldn't get sick of the free-flow alcohol and food from 5 to 7pm. Not the best ambience but the food and drinks made up for it. I do wish that they extent the cocktails evening to 8pm but considering they are turning over for hotel guest that are paying for their drinks, I can't say much.  Wasn't able to get late check out when I was staying in the Club room but managed to get it when I was staying in the…
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel has a very high image of themselves.  The lobby is terribly crowded with bus tours of people wanting to see the "iconic" hotel and you have to fight your way thru the crowds to get to your elevator.    Service was sub par.  The hotel pool is not that amazing- think 2561 rooms in the hotel and this many guests trying to use a very small pool and take selfies at the pools edge. This is not a pool to relax at.   You can never find a chair and the lounge chairs are on top of each other.  Water pressure in our room was very low and one day we had not hot water due to a mechanical breakdown. We needed to run the water for a long time to clear out the brown water once our water was restored.     The hotel rooms were not as well appointed as I anticipated- having stayed at…
label: Negative

Comments: Stayed here with my wife in a garden view room in tower 2, on th 33rd floor. We stayed 3 nights, plenty to see and do would highly recommend this hotel. Friendly staff, plenty to see, the gardens and the light show are spectacular.
label: Positive

Comments: This hotel has a clean, modern and decent size room with large bathroom. The only thing that I did not like was the lobby and how busy it was, it took a while for us to check in as there were so many people lining up. The lobby was full of tourist but lack space to sit. Having said that, I feel safe staying around this hotel as it has a team of security personnel who seems to be on alert at all times. The infinity pool is the feature of this hotel.
label: Neutral

Comments: So.........I really wanted to love the Marina Bay Sands, I mean, look at it, right, it’s an iconic part of the skyline of Singapore. It’s like the Empire State Building in NYC, the Transamerica Pyramid in San Francisco and the Wilshire Grand Intercontinental in my beloved “El Lay”. You see an image of the building and the city it is in immediately comes to mind and you are flooded with the sights, sounds and smells of the city, you are there in every possible tangible way.  I came away liking it intensely but, it was not a love affair, architecturally, it is phenomenal, it makes a memorable first impression. The staff are extremely professional, warm and welcoming. They anticipated my every need and the service provided was flawless, they greeted me by name and were able to…
label: Positive

Comments: This is place whereby you do not have ur own privacy, when u go up to the pool< everyone is asking ur help to take a photo. the employees there treat you like seeing doctor. NEXT! overcrowded. never going there again
label: Negative

Comments: We stayed for 2 nights in a premier king room on the 13th Floor.  We arrived early around 11.30am, but our room was ready, and they said the luggage would take 15 mins to come up to our room.  15 minutes later a knock at the door and our luggage arrived with a very helpful staff member who offered to show us the facilities and features of the room.  He also handed me an envelope which contained a written apology for the delay in our bags arriving - wow what service.  Bathroom was massive and with really nice toiletries which is what you would expect from a 5 star hotel.  Having a garden view meant we had a large balcony over looking the gardens by the bay, which also meant we could see the light show from our balcony - stunning!  The infinity pool was spectacular and we…
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed here for one night mainly to experience the infinity pool, but also the hotel in general. We'd booked a King Deluxe room and from the moment we stepped out of the taxi the service we received could not have been more friendly, personal, quick and thoughtful. The room itself was big, had all the technology you could wish with some nice extras such as the curtains automatically opening when you enter the room.  The views from our room on the 49th floor were also special. Of course the infinity pool was unforgettable and we spent most of the afternoon and into the evening enjoying the experience.  The staff were quick to look after you with food and drink and when we did briefly leave and then return, they even remembered our names, which was a nice touch. The lifeguards…
label: Positive

Comments: We had booked a king club room and to our delight we were upgraded to an orchid suite.upon entering the room the curtains opened automatically to reveal a stunning view of the botanical gardens below. Our room was simply magnificent a really spacious lounge area with lots of comfortable seating, an equally spacious bed area with a huge really comfortable bed. Adjacent to that was another spacious area with a free standing bath which we found to be big enough for two, a separate enclosed toilet and the biggest shower cubicle we’ve ever seen. The room package included a complimentary afternoon tea at the restaurant on level 55 of tower two which was superb. Later also included was champagne and canapés at the same location. The champagne was certainly free flowing and we were both…
label: Positive

Comments: An unbelievable expereince. Met off the plane, taken through the airport and guided to the Sands by limo! Personal check-in and taken to the room overlooking the city nightscape from the 39th floor. The whole experience was truly wonderful. An hotel not to be missed.
label: Positive

Comments: One stop hotel at the marina area, stay there for one night in a suits. Service was f@ntastic, staffs very helpful and kind. Good food within the resort. Will certainly c9me back for staycation.  Bed were very comfortable @nd room sp@cious.
label: Positive

Comments: I arrived with my family after a long flight around 12pm. As I entered I was taken by a lovely man to the VIP area to check in. I thought this would make the process quick and easy. Ended up I was standing there with the check in lady for 45 minutes with her tapping away on the computer.   When I first said hello and began to check in I asked her if it was possibly to stay an additional night (had booked for 2 nights but had a flight leaving late at night so would have loved to have the room for an extra night). She began typing away and then told me that I had booked a room with only two 120cm single beds in it (to accommodate 2 adults and 2 kids). I had entered the number of people staying in the room on booking and from looking at the pictures presumed we had 2 queen sized…
label: Negative

Comments: We stayed three nights on the 46th floor, tower 2 bay/garden view. Our room was nicely appointed. Separate tub and large shower. Comfortable king bed. Breakfast, high tea & evening drinks and appetizers were included. However the club lounge on the 55th floor, tower 2 can get very busy and a long wait...Depending on time of day and week. We were able to take a dip in the infinity pool (early in the morning)...it gets very busy too. We also visited the casino (not too smoky) and the observation deck (included with room)
label: Positive

Comments: Had the best holiday, room exceptional from the moment we opened the door and the curtains drawer back to show the gardens by the bay, the room beautiful, the bathroom very modern , had the best time, staff excellent customer service always very nice the pool is superb, loved our room so much we ordered room service at night so we could sit on our balcony and watch the light show from Gardens by the bay, the Super Trees are amazing, had the best time,
label: Positive

Comments: Amazing light show music and lasers also watching the small lit up boats in the marina   The lion when lit looks amazing but be prepared for crowds at the best vantage points However when cloady the Lasers tend to disappear. But still worth seeing .and its free
label: Positive

Comments: Booked a premier king room but was not ready when we checked in at around 2.30pm. Was given a twin room due to availability and check-out time extended by an hour. Staff were friendly and helpful especially the slim chinese lifeguard over at the baby’s pool. Our room was cleaned and necessities re-stocked about 1.5hours after we arrived. Only inconvenience was the unavailability of halal food except for Coffee Bean at the Shoppes. Thank you for the complimentary birthday cake.
label: Positive

Comments: This hotel represents the highlight of Singapore and a spot on most of the travelers' bucket list. The luxury is completed by the SciFi surroundings. It does not even matter the price. It is a must see once on a lifetime :). This hotel is the definition of the show (no matter day or night).
label: Positive

Comments: We had wonderful experience from the airport to in room checkin. The staff  provided a wonderful service . They went above and beyond , nothing was too hard especially the staff in Club 55. (thanks guys :) )   We had amazing views from our room over the Bay Garden's. Simply a wonderful experience !!!!!!!
label: Positive

Comments: It was wonderful vacation with my family, The hotel is too busy but they have many  stuff to recover the customers.  The room was amazing, the must beautiful thing is the swimming pool high of secured and it was too safe , my kids love the place.  About the mall amazing and there are many shops and celebrities restaurant also the food court.  On my opinion if you want to visit Singapore there are only one place you really must see it its Marina Bay Sands .
label: Positive

Comments: Having only one night to spend in Singapore, I decided to go all out and book at the Marina Bay Sands - and I’m so glad I did! This hotel is so ultramodern, even the curtains open and close at the touch of a button. At night the hotel with its three towers and the SkyPark on top looks like a kind of starship... The SkyPark itself is a unique experience; the infinity pool seems to dissolve into the city skyline and you feel as though you’re almost flying over Singapore when you’re in it. My room was very spacious and comfortable and every amenity was there. And the staff were superlatively helpful. My recommendation: Splurge on a night’s stay here; you’ll always remember it!
label: Positive

Comments: It is exactly how one would imagine ...huge , overwhelming , beautiful ! There are however things that could be improved . The front reception area is exhausting because it can get quite busy and there is no welcoming place to sit . If arriving early ( as we did , at 7 in the morning ) the rooms can take up till 2 o'clock to be ready ...that is not brilliant when you have had a long journey and just want to lie down , have a shower and relax. The pool is great !
label: Positive

Comments: one of best experiences in Singapore. hotel is dominating marina bay with its architecture and size. hotel is pricey but it is worth every single dollar. infinity pool at top floor is really must see, views of city is beautiful. 5 stars in this hotel are deserved
label: Positive

Comments: A must stay experience whilst in Singapore. This Hotel has everything g you could possibly want and is lux to the max. I stayed 4 nights and it was amazing. I stayed in tower 3 with a city view which was just spactactular, good view of the nightly light shows as well. The room was spacious and extremely comfortable, serviced daily and I was provided with more than I needed. Loved the shower, an endless flow of hot water and it helped soothe the body after a vigorous day of sight seeing. It's very busy at the Hotel as it has over two and a half thousand rooms but there is plenty of room for everyone. The infinity pool is a highlight and I particularly liked that there was an adult only section which life guards ensured was adhered too. It can get quite windy up there so if you…
label: Positive

Comments: This hotel is the iconic building (three towers) which can be considered the landmark of Singapore. If you see any advertisements of Singapore, you'll find this hotel in the back ground. I stayed here with my wife for three nights. It's a good 20-25 minute taxi ride from Changi Airport. Check-in was a breeze. We stayed in a club room--our room was facing the marina (highly recommend this view) versus the harbor view. The view is magnificent. The room is extremely spacious; bathroom/bath/shower is all very nice--but slowly showing its age.  The best part of hotel is hands down the Infinity Pool on the top floor (roof).  Try to get there first thing in the morning when they open (6am) when it's still empty. It's so serene with the backdrop of high rises in Singapore and the night…
label: Positive

Comments: The property offer a very futuristic design, especially for a luxury hotel. The hotel looks most spectacular during the evening light and sound show. The infinity pool isn’t for those fearful of heights, but is is amazing.
label: Positive

Comments: Check in was smooth. Room was more than enough for two people. Amazing window overlooking the city on the 40+ floor. And the pool was the overall highlight. Can get crowded  but definitely what you would have expect.
label: Positive

Comments: There are some AMAZING things to staying at this hotel but honestly there are some things that, in my own opinion, were not 5 start worthy .  Some of the good things about being here is of course the famous infinity pool located on the 57th floor with the amazing view of the city. You also would be occupied here for days as there are a lot of things to do in and near the hotel. There is a water/light show on every night at 8pm which I would highly recommend anyone to go see!  I ate a chicken bahn-mi poolside which was delicious! A long with some higher class restaurants on the rooftop and of none of them were to your taste there are lot of places to eat at the shopping centre!  The view of the gardens from our room on the 34th floor was beautiful too!  However some of the things…
label: Positive

Comments: Hotel was fantastic and everything its cracked up to be ... pool fabulous people watching - selfie central. Staff were courteous, kind, polite and clearly hand picked. Excellent service.   Expensive (ie. $16 a beer) at the pool but not unexpected. Plenty of food options to choose from and rooms all extremely clean and serviced.   Definitely worth a visit to say you’ve done it ...
label: Positive

Comments: Great view from the amazing infinity pool, nice and clean room, and superb spa center. Amazing experience.  Breakfast was fresh and nice also.  Be sure to check out gardens behind as they are beautiful.
label: Positive
