Comments: Had the pleasure of staying here twice it is one of the best experiences I have had, if you are ever visiting Singapore treat yourself , even of its just one night, this place is fantastic. from the rooms themselves to the sky park there is something for everyone.
label: Positive

Comments: My partner and I organised to stay two nights in Singapore (22/1-24/1) at the end of our trip to Vietnam and Cambodia, specifically because we wanted to stay at the Marina Bay Sands because it’s such an incredible building and facility. We checked in, which felt very rushed and impersonal, which was quite a shock from what we were used to in Vietnam and Cambodia, but somewhat understandable for a hotel of this scale. We entered the lift and two chefs from Spago (the rooftop restaurant) in their uniforms were having a loud conversation and swearing profusely in front of us and other guests. We didn’t realise it at the time but this was a foreshadow of the horrible service we were going to receive for the remainder of our trip. The hotel itself is beautiful, the rooftop pool is…
label: Negative

Comments: It was our last days of holidays in Asia and I decided to treat us with a night here mostly to use the pool. We did not regret the experience. It was not cheap but it was not impossible to pay. In London for something similar you would pay A LOT more.  The pool was excellent. The view from the infinity pool are stunning. The pool opens at 6AM so that you can see the sunrise.  The room was huge with excellent views to the city skyline. We asked nicely and we were given a room in a much higher floor than expected.
label: Positive

Comments: Amazing hotel, very good and clean room, pool is incredible, breafast is very good, location is excellent. The only things were not good: - checking staff was not very friendly - booking was done 6 months in advance for floor between 10 and 39. And guess what? We were put on 11th floor.
label: Positive

Comments: This is a busy hotel. 2500 hotel rooms. Check in was superbly handled by the staff, we had a corner suite for our 25th wedding anniversary. The views were amazing. Club privileges were a delight and worth treating yourself to. Staff handled these crowds well with drinks topped up and food replenished.  I found the infinity pool cold and very crowded. Checkout was easy. Thank you
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for my 60th Birthday and it did not disappoint. Our room was located on the 39th floor with spectacular city views. The infinity pool, that i’m sure everyone is familiar with, is as spectacular as all the photos out there. It’s perfectly located to the lovely Gardens by the Bay and exquisite shopping areas.
label: Positive

Comments: Room : 7/10 Pool : 10/10 Breakfast : 8/10 View : 10/10 Im back to stay in marina bay sands hotel... because im really love stay in here... i like infinity pool, have a great view city in singapore...  prices never lie !
label: Positive

Comments: We had a 3 day stay at Marina Bay Sands and I'm embarassed to say we didnt leave the hotel complex + gardens by the bay. We shopped 1 day, with a nice dinner at wakugin at night, went to gardens by the bay another day with the seafood buffet at night and spent most of the last day lounging by the pool.. and what a pool it is. Best infinity pool I've swam in.  If I had to fault 1 thing it would be service. Checking in was surprisingly tardy and they were pretty strict on not allowing us to check in too early as we had an early flight
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel is new but showing signs of wear and tear. I paid over $500 for King Harbor view room on the 50th floor. The a/c is not cooling like it should and making a lot of noise. The bed is uncomfortable and too hard.The lobby is very very crowded. I would visit the hotel but not stay here - it’s not worth it even with the nice infinity pool on the 57th floor. There is no quite place in the entire hotel common areas for one to relax. You will be dodging people everywhere. Don’t pay the high rates and stay here , it ain’t worth it.
label: Neutral

Comments: Everything about this hotel is amazing with one exception , people would go up to the pool  as soon as it opened at 6am in the morning and put towels on the chairs to 'save' them for up to as many as 6  friends ( we actually witnessed this 3 times in a week) and the pool attendants did nothing to stop it. We would go back to the pool at 10am and there was the culprit with his friends arriving at the same time as us and they all just took up the pool seats he had saved 4 hours earlier. We did complain ,only to be told this doesn't happen!!!! Really, yes it does we saw it.
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed here on 28 December for 2 nights as a stop off Enroute to Australia. This was a treat as part of my partners 60th Birthday celebrations.  We arrived late evening and were checked in immediately. We stayed on the 30th floor and had a city view.  Because of the size of this hotel it is impersonal, that said the staff we did come into contact with were polite and pleasant. We were given a complimentary birthday cake for my partner which was a very nice touch. The views from the pool are spectacular however the water temperature was way too cold for me!  We had breakfast included and we enjoyed what was on offer. My biggest disappointment was there was no place to sit whilst waiting for our transport to the airport. We had around 4 hours to wait from check out to…
label: Positive

Comments: We booked a club room with garden view but got way and above what we expected. We also had a city view from the full wall window in the bathroom.  Both spectacular. According to rough measurement room appeared to be about 900 square feet in area with two huge patio door windows leading on to a long balcony.  There were dining table and chairs - three piece suite - huge bed - all absolutely beautiful.  We were entitled to breakfast, afternoon tea, and beverages and snacks from 5pm to 7pm in Club 55.  This is much better than it sounds. This was not tea or snacks.  It was high quality food cooked in delightful ways and, unlike other  club rooms we have booked, it did not run out. It was easy to drink too much. The staff treated us like royalty, I can't understand the people who…
label: Positive

Comments: it was a birthday gift for hubby but felt guilty of spending so much for a room with a view and a pool in the sky. Nevertheless it was nice choice and felt good watching the city from 31st floor with the light shows across the river in the evening. since we had spent so much thus we did not go out of the room much and enjoyed it to the max.  The pool is always crowded and we did not swim in the evening. We instead choose to swim early morning whereby not many people were there around 7am.  Enjoyed the breakfast in the room, and thankful for the slice of birthday cake surprise. Also check in could improve as we had to wait almost 40 minutes in the long que which took the toll. otherwise overall a great experience and may consider to come back if we have done with the rest of the…
label: Neutral

Comments: The Marina Bay Sands Hotel touts itself as a 5 star hotel. Yet it is just another gigantic hotel. The pool, however is magnificent. It’s certainly worth a one night stay just to enjoy the view and changes in the sky as the dawn approaches dusk.
label: Positive

Comments: My boyfriend booked this hotel as a surprise for me for our time in Singapore. It was the best surprise ever, I’ve always wanted to stay here. It did not disappoint, the room was beautiful, very clean and modern. Loved the balcony, we had a view facing the gardens. We watched the light show of the trees from our room. The infinity pool was insane, we had the pool to ourselves at sunset for a short time, the weather was so bad before and we waited (the only people left waiting) so got it to ourselves. The best experience ever. Thank you for such an amazing time here. We will be back!
label: Positive

Comments: This place lives up to all the expectations you’d expect from just a prominent place.  It was our first visit and we booked ourselves in for just 1 night of our visit as a treat. They always try and upgrade people visiting for the first time so we got a super high up room facing the city. The views were amazing.   The room itself was nice and spacious and everything you’d need.  And obviously the iconic sky pools are awesome. It’s a breathtaking place to go, we were busy in the evening so didn’t watch sunset but instead got up super early for sunrise. It’s harder to watch sunrise just because of the layout but it rained anyway so sadly we did t really see much.  The gardens side is a pretty awesome outlook, would definitely pick that side if we went back.   We also enjoyed one…
label: Positive

Comments: Quick check-in even in the festive season, efficient lead time to process requests and spacious rooms. These things do mark for a five star rating but what else for if one pays $799 for one night. Lesser options for vegans if one opts for spago for breakfast. Sometimes staff doesn't even bother to pay an ear and just keep on repeating that they value customers and would do anything to extend help, but once you try to put your requests, they interrupt with the same speech all over. (We requested an extension for one hour to check the sky park deck. Our access keys stopped working at 11:45 AM although we still had 15 minutes left. We kept on requesting the reception team and they did honor our request too but like after half an hour. We made sure that the room was checked out at…
label: Neutral

Comments: We have had a fantastic time as we enjoyed a spacious suite with all comfort you can dream of, on the 51st floor with marina view! The rim pool is just out of this world. The breakfast is a huge buffet and provides the right option for each and everybody. Prices are not cheap  but the 10,000 people working in this Hotel with over 2,000 beds need to earn a living! We will definitely be back.
label: Positive

Comments: This was our second stay at Marina Bay. Spent two nights on the way home from Europe. Didn’t leave the hotel the whole stay as there is no need to. Stayed in grand club room which was fantastic. Great food and drinks included at Club55. Amazing pool not too crowded. Will be back.
label: Positive

Comments: What a great way to see Singapore from above...absolutely stunning! The views are spectacular and don't miss the opportunity to have a glass of wine while enjoying the view. Unless you stay at the hotel unfortunately you can't enjoy a dip in the pool...but still worth a visit.
label: Positive

Comments: Sadly this hotel was too big to offer a personal service . We booked two rooms . One was fine with lovely views , unfortunately the second one was not ! It was too noisy from the road outside the window . When we informed the check in clerk of this the only solution offered was to up grade to a larger room . Our son didn’t want a larger room , just a room he could sleep in !   We explained that the minimum a room should provide was the ability to sleep , this was ignored by the staff and they just kept repeating that an up grade charged at £30 a night extra was the only course to take !!!!!  We paid this as it was apparent that we were not going to be offered any other remedy .   The pool area was too crowded also . I would recommend booking elsewhere in Singapore.
label: Negative

Comments: We stayeg 2 nights on January with 2 children. It is not so expensive hotel as we thought and it is very good so 2 children cam stay free if they share exsisting beds with parents. We booked Premium room wgich is bigger than the Lux room- the room is big enough for our family, good quality, the bathroom is also perfect with bath and shower. If you take a room with Gardens by the bay you have a balcony( I think that other side rooms- City view- dont have  balconies). We love that because we can watch from our balcony light show in the evening in gardens. The swimmingpool is open till 11 p.m. and it is real great and this is the reason most guests stay there. It is on 57 floor and the staff check if you are a hotel guest to use a pool. And I think it is ok- without it everybody…
label: Positive

Comments: I would give the spaciousness and cleanliness of the room 5/5 stars but because there is really nothing much to do here except for shopping which I hate most. And most importantly the breathtaking view from the freezing infinity pool it’s like seeing a sea of White Walkers at The Wall. If only they could regular the water temperature and the amount of people stoning around spending hours just taking selfies.
label: Neutral

Comments: I can’t speak highly enough of this place. Our room was ready at only 9am so was allowed to check in, our bags where brought promptly to our room. Straight to the pool, was not as busy as anticipated having read the reviews. No problem getting sun lounger and the perfect picture. The whole site is amazing, the shoppes, the casino, watching the marina light show from our hotel room I will never forget it. Can’t wait to return already. So sad to be leaving. But you know what they say... don’t be sad that it’s over, be happy that if happened
label: Positive

Comments: Booked a 2 day stay during my trip to Singapore. . . After seeing the hotel ‘lowest pricing guarantee’ heavily advertised all throughout their website and How be guaranteed that their prices are so low, but if you are able to find a lower price, they will match the price and also give you a room upgrade. All of these promises invoked me to book my stay directly with them without looking at other websites.   I read over the terms and conditions to ensure I understood how their policy worked.   Feeling Pretty confident about my booking,  I then advised my partner about our booking and the Price  guarantee so naturally, he took this as a challenge and decided to go online and see if there were any  websites that were offering the same room for a lower price.   Almost immediately,…
label: Negative

Comments: When writing reviews of properties I try to follow how Robert Parker reviews wines, and review the hotel based on what particular hotel is supposed to be. So if you’re looking for a small luxury boutique hotel, which I normally do, this is not it. Normally I stay away from large casino hotels completely, but having seen the Netflix show and “Crazy Rich Asians,” i decided to give it a go.  I expected to be amazed at the sky park, and I was. The views from our room on the 51st floor are jaw-dropping. It was quite an interesting place to people watch with folks running around in bathrobes and evening gowns at night. What I didn’t expect was the level of service at such a huge hotel.  The staff at Club 55 are the reason i am giving the hotel 5 stars. Definitely make sure you book a…
label: Positive

Comments: Room  overlooked  the beautiful Marine bay gardens. Highest affinity pool on 57th floor with spectacular view over city..  Breakfast buffet out of this world.. Well worth the visit but e sure to book as hotel is very popular.
label: Positive

Comments: Obviously the hotel is glamorous- I saw the show on Netflix and decided to book it at $650 USD a night! Clearly it’s ambitious and views are absolutely stunning. Food is wonderful and the staff is absolutely courteous.  However it’s a FISH MARKET with 1000s of people bumping into you. Endless lines for everything from room service to checkin.   Swimming pool is overcrowded and pathetic with people just standing taking endless pictures all day. No one is swimming. I just didn’t like the crowd this hotel attracts. It’s more of a tourist spot for people to say they visited than a luxury hotel. I didn’t feel luxurious period.  Never visiting again
label: Negative

Comments: Quite likely the best hotel I've stayed in, in all my life. Everything is absolutely perfect. It faces The Gardens and is adjacent to a massive mall and food court. Cant wait to go back! The three towers are massive, so if you are a group try and stay in the same one as it takes time to get from one to the other. Also the infamous infinity pool is a must!
label: Positive

Comments: We booked a premier room with the view of the harbour. Looking out of the balcony, we could also see the Gardens By The Bay and watch the lights show in the evening. The room was also very clean and the hotel service was excellent. We requested for bubble bath and it was sent to our room in around 5 minutes. Very efficient indeed!
label: Positive

Comments: My husband and I couldn't have been happier with our stay! Everything was absolutely perfect. Our room was lush (amazing view!!!), the service was wonderful and the restaurants we dined at were worth every penny! The pool is stunning and the bar service by the pool is actually pretty reasonable.  Amazing location. We can't wait to go back!!!
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands was beautiful, went to the sky deck for a drink and the view was amazing, minimal waiting time and we went in peak so very happy. I think a ticket up was about $30 Australian and that included a cocktail and as long as you wanted up there.
label: Positive

Comments: I was a bit worried that this hotel would not live up to the "hype" but it was AMAZING. Seriously, form the moment you walk in, to check out, the staff are so helpful, the hotel is so clean and its just amazing to be there after seeing it online and on TV.  The lobby is huge and reminded me of hotels in Vegas, very big and grand. The staff are very helpful and offered us to upgrade our room for a charge, we said no because only staying for two nights. When we got to our room, it was huge! Big bed, separate lounger, chair and desk and a balcony over looking the gardens by the bay. What a view! The bathroom was also big and very clean. The best part is of course the swimming pool on the top floor. WOW! Clean, very big and lots of space for families with a separate area for adults…
label: Positive

Comments: As fairly regular travellers to Singapore, my husband and I had promised ourselves we'd stay here at some point. We stayed for 3 nights in a club room. As a club guest on first arrival you are shown into a private check in room. However, this is not like any other club check in I have experienced. Guests take a ticket and sit in a fairly soulless waiting room that reminded me of an airline lounge. There was no guest greeting, no cold/hot towels, no served drinks, or other special touches. Just sit and wait then go to a desk to check in.  The bedroom was spacious and light but it really was nothing special. The decor was bland and the light wood used looked cheap. The hotel had the opportunity to build in some features such as an open plan bathroom or windows on to the bathroom…
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed at MBS last year for just the one day after a cruise and before going home.  We enjoyed that stay so much, that this year we returned and stayed longer (3 days).  The foyer is dauntingly huge, and is more like a railway station than a hotel.  However, check in was efficient, and once you are given your room, all is good!  We stayed in a Premier room, on the 8th floor in Tower 2, which is on the lower end of the $ scale.  It's still excellent.  The room is very large, with a very nice bathroom.  The service is prompt which is incredible for such a large hotel.  The location is a bit out of the centre of town, but with the MRT station directly below the hotel, and a shopping centre next door, it's very convenient. Yeah, it's pricey, but Singapore is an expensive place,…
label: Positive

Comments: Arrived at the hotel and were amazed at the sheer size of it it looks amazing from the outside however once inside felt I was in a City hundreds and hundred of people everywhere had to queue for everything, upgraded to a higher floor, at a charge, but room was great really big and spacious and view was amazing. Infinity pool was fab but again packed and couldn't get a bed, even at seven in morning, breakfast on the roof was really nice although again if you arrived after seven had to queue. Light show was an experience and well worth watching. All in all a great experience as a one off put very expensive as everything seems to have tax and service charge added to the price and it all appears a bit cold and surreal.
label: Positive

Comments: Just spent the last 2 days trying to pre book and pre pay for a night’s stay at the Marina Bay Hotel. Over the years I have booked 100s of rooms and in most cases pre paid for them but never have I come across anything as difficult as this one. It’s not a process for Mr average in fact if you have a degree in IT you should be ok. Just looking forward to my night there as I am really excited at stopping there. I will post a new review after our stay but sorry Marina Bay Sands Hotel I cannot recommend you booking and paying system.
label: Negative

Comments: During check-in we got a free upgrade, so we ended up in a huge room with excellent facilities and service. Enough space to relax after a long trip, comfy bed and couch. Excellent breakfast, you can choose from three different restaurants that serve both European as well as Asian breakfast style, all very delicious, one of them being on the root top. There was a smaller queue, so you had to wait to be seated. Excellent views over the city. The hotel is well situated, with easy access to the metro to visit the city. Enough opportunities to be entertained, in the evening there is a great laser show, there is a theatre, museum and lots of shops. The place is supercrowded with people, all the time, but the room is a nice place to retreat. We had an excellent stay there, one we will…
label: Positive

Comments: We had a stop over in Singapore for a day on the way to the Philippines so decided to treat ourselves to a stay in Marina Bay Sands. Although it’s pricey we paid £350 for a night with breakfast and family room, it was worth it. The roof top pool is just amazing, in the day and especially at night.(get a selfy stick) The room was huge with a spectacular city view. The buffet breakfast in the roof top restaurant was delicious, I wish I could have ate more. In the ground floor there is an escalator that takes you down to a huge shopping centre with high end shops and loads of eateries. On the other side there is a bridge that takes you across the road to Gardens by the Bay, which is well worth a walk around. On the whole we had a great stay and can’t wait to come back next year,…
label: Positive

Comments: It was a bucket list stay of three nights with the token picture in the infinity pool. However, for the price we believe there are better places to stay such as the Pan Pacific. The view from our room was amazing and the room itself large and comfortable but you pay for it. The pool was crowded and if you wanted to be near the pool you needed to be there at 8.30 in the morning or after 7 at night. It was also incredibly expensive to eat with breakfast at $53.00 (SG) each, however because of a fabulous location there is access to many great areas outside the hotel. Absolutely glad we did it but will not be returning
label: Positive

Comments: If you are a woman, a western woman, don’t come here. Misogyny abounds, from the fact that the photographers in the pool avoid you as if you were invisible, to the inspection you will get at the casino.  The Asian mentality is still decades behind and a woman traveling alone is not ok yet . It’s sad but true . This place is grand and beautiful but the turnover is so huge- occupancy is 95%!! That they really don’t care- there is no hair dryer, no scale in the room, breakfast is a whopping 60$ and a tip of 10% is automatically added on everything. The hotel/ casino/ mall is larger than many small cities - and magnificently designed by Israeli Moshe Safdie. But it’s crazy crowded and especially the pool - Although beautiful, is not really a place to go to relax. See the city from…
label: Neutral

Comments: Whilst Marina Bay Hotel is expensive it is well worth going at least once, we enjoyed a few days there are had a great time, the service from all staff was amazing, whilst it is expensive don’t let that turn you off trying it at least once.
label: Positive

Comments: The quality and standard of room furnishing surpassed the guest's expectations! The service was prompt, responsive and personal attention to details. The views from the room facing the Gardens by the Bay and open sea were stunning and splendid! Especially when you go right up to the SkyPark, the Infinity Pool was captivating and the panoramic views of the city skylines and vast open sea were magnificent.
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel is in prime location. We have a lovely room from the higher floor. The club 55 buffet was great, to top it all the unlimited champagne. The variety of buffet in the Club 55 could be better especially during tea time. A bit disappointed by check-in as they cannot find my booking even after presenting my booking reference i have in my phone and the credit card payment. The guy who is checking us very impatient and quite rude.  They are using roberto cavalli products on their club member room which is great  but no turn down services as what you expected in a hotel like this.  But over all a beautiful experience.
label: Positive

Comments: We have visited Singapore many times but usually stay in the same couple of hotels. We decided to try somewhere different having seen many photos of the impressive rooftop infinity pool. The view from the pool is indeed a treat. However, that’s where the positives end. It is otherwise like every other ‘beige’ international tourist hotel. It is over priced & we found it somewhat vulgar. The lovely pool has become what should be designated ‘competition for the best ‘selfie’ zone’. The hotel is enormous leaving it soulless. It is a ‘tourist sight’ of itself with tour groups frequenting the foyer. Overall it lacked all charm & left us feeling like we were on a giant narcissistic cruise ship!
label: Neutral

Comments: Excellent location, very friendly people, we arrived hotel around 10:00 am, but they let us check in right away. That helps a lot. It’s like we got one extra day at Singapore. The view from our room was awesome day and night. Highly recommend!
label: Positive

Comments: Very good location, clean hotel (it's not easy to keep such a huge hotel very clean), very spacious room with nice view (we were on the very high floor), nice infinity pool with amazing view (and maybe not very amazing people ;) taking "million" selfies), when we needed help regarding two little issues in our room we got it promptly, check-in and check-our process was relatively fast in spite of huge number of guests... Maybe the AC in our room could work a bit better and maybe there should be additional speed for fan (so that the lowest speed is a bit "slower" than the existing one) but this is minor remark.
label: Positive

Comments: Infinity pool, sky observation deck, gardens by the bay, Singapore flyer, art museum, grandeur architecture, Merlion Park doesn't seem attractive to u then im not sure what will. This hotel in itself is located strategically and is so magnificent that every penny spent here is worth Ur pockets. From children to adults to seniors this property will hv Ur eyes glued 24*7. The breakfast spread was lavish & the entire process of entering & leaving the hotel is just superbly arranged. All nearby attractions are just 10-12 walking & the city is very very safe around late hours even.
label: Positive

Comments: We love the infinity pool, excellent views and good ambiance. The security is quiet strict even though you are a Hotel guests.Quite crowded during weekend.. The lobby is lacked of chairs while waiting in the long Queues.. But everything is alright the hotel with a thousand rooms what you expect... The staff trying their best to give an extra mile service... Do not stay here  during weekends and holidays..
label: Neutral

Comments: We have visited Marina Bay Sands as a part of our trip in Asia.  Hotel location is perfect, close to shoping malls, casino and undergroud station. Check in is little bit long due to size of this hotel. We stayed on 50th floor with beautiful view to down town. The size and equipement of our room was great. We have been very satisfied with our accomodation.  We enjoyed breakfat at Club55 with great view. The selection, quality and service wasn’t so great, but OK. The best was the view. We also tried afternoon tea, wich I recomend not to have..., becouse variety and quality of food was very low :-( We experienced swimming pool on the roof with beautiful view, but extremly overcrowded.  Our tip: Take room in higher floors and visit food corner in nearby shoping mall and try laksa…
label: Positive

Comments: This trip we have stayed at the Peninsula in Beijing, Pan Pacific in Singapore, and the Marina Bay Sands. For most people, including ourselves, the Marina Bay Sands is a luxury trip. I would recommend staying elsewhere and just coming to Marina Bay to visit.
label: Positive

Comments: Amazing hotel! We stopped on the 8th floor and had incredible views of the Gardens By The Bay.   The hotel and shopping mall is huge. Although the hotel is pricey it’s worth it to use the infinity pool we used it at 8am in the morning and 9pm at night and had no problem getting sun beds even though it is very busy.   Once in a lifetime experience, the views are incredible and marina bay sands is one of the main attractions in Singapore. We found it very easy to walk to most of the main attractions in Singapore and the MRT can be accessed from inside the hotel.   We ate at the yardbird which was nice please be aware some of the restaurants and shops offer a discount for staying at the hotel this is very poorly advertised we found a booklet in the draw of our hotel room. We signed…
label: Positive

Comments: I was worried about the high price and some iffy reviews, but I really wanted my family to experience the infinity pool on our short stay in Singapore.  We loved it!  The staff was amazing and our rooms were very nice and updated.  We had a city view but it was very nice.  Check in took a very, very long time but it was because the staff spent so long with each person to review things thoroughly.  Pool was really incredible- not to be missed!!  We were a little freaked out when we first walked out onto the pool area but you get adjusted quickly.  Yes, this place is expensive but it was some of the best money we spent on the trip.
label: Positive

Comments: This place is incredible you can spend the whole day just walking around the shops and restaurants, $20 gets you up to the sky bar which you the exchange for a drink , Hang around for the laser light show at 8pm and 9pm it’s just spectacular
label: Positive

Comments: We ate in Spago, the food and service were excellent offering international flavours in a tapas style -strongly recommend a visit and request a table so you can take full advantage of the view -we also tried Lavo on another day but the service didn't compare at all well to Spago's so we had a drink cancelled our reservation and went back to Spago -it didn't disappoint
label: Positive

Comments: Our room was on the 7th floor so the view was awful, with people visiting the adjacent shopping mall looking into our room. The two stars are because the swimming pool was wonderful but that's it; all the rest of our accommodation in this hotel was awful. I visited the swimming pool for the whole 5 days of my visit in the morning, at around 9.00 am and always found place; once I was there at 5.00 pm and was more crowded but you just have to look at the left towels on the chair and remove them and you will find the place because a lot of rude customers leave them on the chairs even when they leave. Never tried the restaurants, just the snack bar at the swimming pool that is extremely expensive: 200 Eur for a cheese sandwich, two burgers, 4 glasses of wine and a tonic water
label: Neutral

Comments: Our room on the 37th floor has amazing views over Singapore but the drawcard of staying there was the pool. Lives up to the photographs, amazing. But get there early morning or late evening as during the day is absolutely packed. A must is dinner at Ce La Vi for an amazing meal and experience.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina bay sands is one of the top hotels in Singapore. The hotel is a bit crowded but has some amazing restaurants and shops. The best part about the hotel is the infinity pool on the top floor which is only accessible if you stay in the hotel.
label: Positive

Comments: Amazing! We stayed in Singapore for a 2 day stop over. We were spoilt the whole time by any staff member we encountered. The room was immaculate! With extra towels and clean fresh bedding. The pool is amazing! The photos don’t do it justice. However there is no shade and no where to escape to when it rains- which it did! The gym is clean and has adequate equipment. Getting around is mainly by lift. The place is just so big! I’d stay here every time we visit from now on, it was such a memorable experience and I loved every minute of my stay!
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed for 3 nights in October.  Fantastic room. Expensive for just a room but worth it to be able to use the pool. The pool isn’t that deep. It’s quite cold too.  Very busy with Chinese who are quite aggressive and pushy.  Fantastic views! The pool looks over the city which is better at night. The hot tubs look over gardens by the bay and the sea. This view is amazing! We watched the light show from the hot tub one evening in the gardens. Went to the observation deck, very busy with non guests.only hotel guests can access the pool. Food and drink is expensive for what you get.  You get a robe to use to go to the pool in from your room.  The fridge/mini bar is auto charging. Do not take anything out of the fridge!!!! Once you remove it it is automatically charged to your room…
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed in an beautiful 1 bed suite, which was immaculate.   Yes, it’s busy and full of tourist but it really is worth a stay.    The garden and pool on the roof is amazing!  It’s slightly annoying that there are people snapping selfies non stop when you are trying to swim, but with such a spectacular view it’s to be expected.   If you are looking for an intimate hotel where the staff know you, this is not the place for you.  It’s big and busy!
label: Positive

Comments: Awesome hotel ... Infinity pool was amazing... Food in rise restaurant was awesome.. Mr.thomas was very helpful at restaurant.. Overall great experience.. View and location was also wonderful.. Great hospitality...
label: Positive

Comments: Rip off hotel, all facilities crowded or not available, we had to wait for 45 mins just to get a lounge chair. No room in jacuzzi all day. The pools were totally crowded with screaming Chinese kids and screaming mothers everywhere. Zero ambiance. This hotel used to be pretty good (last visit was in 2015). Would not go again.
label: Negative

Comments: Coming back here for staycation 1-2 times a year. Nice and clean hotel. Very friendly staffs. Great amenities with plenty of attractions nearby. 10mins walk to Gardens By the Bay and Singapore Flyer.  Thanks for the birthday cake. Really appreciate.
label: Positive

Comments: Hotel is fantastic as it is very well known property in singapore,but quite expensive for everything. It has a shopping mall inside too This hotel became famous for infinity pool. That was unimaginable
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here as a stopover on way to Australia but it turned out to be so so much more.  We had two rooms - one was more expensive and higher to get better views but to be fair both were excellent and both had great views.   Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were big and clean.  Pool was amazing.  Walking out on rooftop and seeing the view for first time will stay with me for a long time.  Location is great and we enjoyed the botanical gardens and surroundings area.  Only negative could be the queues at checkin but we timed that ok and queue moved well and checkin staff were friendly and helpful
label: Positive

Comments: Upon entering you are given 2 choices, visit the bar or the viewing deck. The best choice by far is to visit the bar which is also ok for children. It will cost $20 but you will also receive a voucher for $20 to  Spend on food or drinks, allowing you to sit and enjoy the view at a leisurely pace.  The food is delicious,the drinks were lovely and the staff were very accommodating. You still can walk around 360 degrees and enjoy the entire view.
label: Positive

Comments: Expensive but I don't regret every single penny spent on this hotel. Staying at this hotel is absolutely the best experience in Singapore. The iconic Infinity pool is great and skywork has great view at night. Room was clean and spacious, fantastic garden view to see supertree show. Convenient location for gardens by the bay. Quite crowded in the lobby and need to wait long for checking in, which is the only let-down point.
label: Positive

Comments: Amazing experience to stay at the Marina Bay Sands and enjoy various amenities especially its iconic Infinity Pool and free access to the Skypark Observatory Deck. The staff are really thoughtful and very accommodating, the rooms are really spacious and luxurious and the surrounding view is so lovely.  I’d like to commend Jaevin from the checkin counter/reception for giving me such a very wonderful corner premiere room and for the nice welcome and checkin experience. And also many thanks to Mendoza for taking care of my luggages. Keep up the great work, guys, and until next time!
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed for 3 nights and ended up stretching to a suite which was the best thing we did. The room was very spacious. It was super clean and the city view we had from floor 51 was amazing. We were able to visit the pool and observation deck as a hotel guest but the best part was club 55 on floor 55 where we had breakfast and evening dinner/drinks. They also offer an afternoon tea a special thank you to 4 people who made our time the best Olga, Vinson, Ralph and Aires! The service provided was exceptional. The pool area has deck chair service cocktails work out about £15 but they add 10%. It was all very clean as expected in Singapore. You can easily reach gardens by the bay and the water light show from here. Casino is good fun you need your passport to get in and out.
label: Positive

Comments: Brought the family for a dinner buffet at RISE and it was a great experience. Service staff were friendly and fast. The buffet may seem a little pricey but the spread is really good. Some recommendations...salmon sashimi, fresh oysters, DIY soda station, indian food spread!!
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel itself is spectacular. The views, the rooms, the surrounding shops and things to do... I mean, this place is definitely amazing, BUT if the hotel is charging that much to stay there, they should really limit the number of guests that can visit the rooftop deck area. Or better yet, designate certain times in a day OR certain days where outsiders can visit.
label: Neutral

Comments: We had traveled as group to celebrate one of our friend birthday and we decided to stay in Marina Bay Sands our last night. Best decision ever as we were super tired from traveling around. Best sleep during that holiday 😁
label: Negative

Comments: Skypark is too overcrowded,  impossible to make any nice photo Staff is very rude and unorganised It took me for an hour just to get out of the building  Not recommend at all. Very disappointed.   Also about the Singapore Sling cocktail which is included in the ticket price ..well we didn’t feel any alcohol inside. Save your time and money and going to somewhere else ;)
label: Neutral

Comments: The lounge offers comfort and space in a busy hotel. Good variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.Fantastic cake trolley. The views of the structure of the hotel add to the experience. The lounge brings a touch of luxury combined with great service, so it does cost more than the average cafe - 3 non-alcoholic drinks and a beer came to $51.
label: Positive

Comments: Spent three nights over new year here. A huge machinery with its 2500 rooms and loads of additional visitors. Everything very well organised though and very professional staff. Roof top infinity pool (which is only accessible for hotel guests) and the view from there is simply spectacular! Pool was open until 1 am on January 1st and we started the new year looking at the city fireworks from the pool. Really cool! Had a room with balcony on floor 49 towards the sea and the gardens by the bay. Fantastic views! Very clean, tidy and well equipped rooms, although the interiors are not what makes this hotel spectacular.
label: Positive

Comments: Stood 2 nights at Marina Bay Sands on my stopover in Singapore before flying back to Brussels.  This is a major Las Vegas factory: 2600 rooms, 3 towers, 57 floors, the highest infinity pool of the world, a huge mall, a casino, 50+ restaurants... My full respect -- I appreciate the complexity of keeping such a machinery up and running.  Room size OK, bathroom OK.  The famous infinity pool: hopelesly overcrowded: imagine a public pool in a big town. Only chance to get a chair by the water: at 6am when it opens, or just after sunset (7:30pm) and before 9pm, when it gets overcrowded again (it closes at 11pm).  The breakfast experience: disgusting. There are 3 restaurants serving breakfast to the armada of guests. Simply not suficient. It is utterly unacceptable to make you queue…
label: Neutral

Comments: This huge hotel, three towers and one amazing sky pool, very elegant restaurants and shops, enjoy the panoramic view of Singapore city and gardens by the bay.. it’s expensive but worth to experience marina bay sands.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands is a wonderful hotel. There's really nothing like that view from the pool, except for maybe the view from the gym. You can see all Singapore, and that just makes everything better.  Plus, the location is great, services flawless and great restaurants.   Hope I can stay there again next time!
label: Positive

Comments: Had a plan to stay there at least one night only give sky pool experience to my boys. The price was too high (SGD 728.56) for me though. Had checked in 9th Jun 2018. My 2 boys been to the pool 3 times while stayed. They really enjoyed the time. it was a feel like swimming in the sky.  One thing i have to mentioned that the crowed was too much considering the size of the pool. However to room was too big for us. we astonished of ambiance of the lobby, the entrance and the entire architecture.  In total the experience was great.    You have to book directly from their web site. you would not get them in agoda or booking.com.
label: Neutral

Comments: This is the worst hotel to stay in Singapore. Plz avoid to book this hotel & save your  hard earned money. Better choose other 5* in the city. 30 minutes is the minimum que for breakfast , 45 min to baggage delivery by Concierge, 45 min to in room dining , 10-15 min for checkin over counter as per Mr Michael who check in me at Tower 3 lobby. He abruptly said that he needs 10 min to check in one room. So in that ratio he said you have total 10 room needs 100 min. This is what this hotel have these kind of management n staff to hire. Asked for house keeping to be done in my room, a guy came with no English speaking. Ordered a pizza which was like a baked cheese bread but when asked said this is our standard. So after paying sgd 800 we get this kind of worst low standard service.…
label: Negative

Comments: We travel is Singapore frequently and our choice is MBS due to its location and convenience. It’s connected to a shopping center food outlets and close to the gardens by the bay and those alike. Room service at the hotel is wonderful, the food is tasty. Housekeeping are great always providing more than enough for us such as extra bottled water and provided my children with mini robes and slippers which they love and towels made into animals with rose petals scattered. The over packed pool situation seems to have improved over the months too Recommended!
label: Positive

Comments: One of the best hotel to stay .we enjoyed the stay .and access to infinity pool.awesome to spend time
label: Positive

Comments: Ok. Now I stayed here for 2 days at the end of my Singapore adventure to relax and enjoy the facilities and believe me when I say I got my money’s worth.  I had booked a club room and if you have the coin to do it, I think it’s the way to go. It costs a bit more, but you get breakfast, afternoon tea and early evening drinks.  The room was huge. The bed was comfy, there were lots of channels on the tv, the view out the window was awesome ( I was directly opposite the laser light show that happened twice nightly). The bathroom was ornate without being overly flashy, but was also about half the size of my house at home, it was big enough to hold a small polo match! The bedroom has a separate lounge area, and a desk, the amount of space was amazing. It was essentially like hiring a…
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed one night at Marina Bay Sands during our vacation in Singapore to mark this iconic hotel of our bucket list. This is a huge hotel with 2500 rooms and feels at times a bit crowded. Luckily we had access to the Lounge Club 55 and avoided the biggest crowds. The infinity pool is amazing an the service was excellent as one should expect from a 5-star hotel. We would not recommend to stay at this hotel over more than a couple of days do the the size of the hotel and the huge crowd.
label: Neutral

Comments: Much has been written concerning this masterpiece of architecture in the modern era; suffice to say, it did not disappoint and I won’t comment any more on the hotel itself, it’s fantastic. I agree with a previous reviewer that the rudeness of the main waiter in C’est La Vie annoyed me considerably and I did complain to management. However, he was the only exception to otherwise magnificent service.  I want to highlight the fantastic service in Renku. We called in for a drink and found a regular place to complete each day. The food served was of the highest quality, the touches of originality in both taste and presentation surprised us. Above all, the service from our lovely waitresses over the four days was over and beyond what we could have expected. Of special mention are…
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands is  an iconic hotel with a huge infinity swimming pool on top of three separate towers. It may be one of the most photographed hotels in the world.  My wife and I were really excited to stay there and had a vision of hanging out at the worlds largest and highest infinity pool in the world. Those plans were dashed the first day when we went up to the top and realized it was an absolute zoo. There were so many people up there that you could hardly find a place to sit. The view is amazing but all the tourist kind of ruin the experience.  We stayed 4 nights, the cost was over $2400 with two of those nights being in a suite on the 54th floor. This is like a Las Vegas casino that is connected to a huge network of shopping malls not unlike Caesars Palace. The staff…
label: Positive

Comments: Incredibly spectacular architecture. Spent my New Year’s get-together/vacation with former classmates at Marina Bay Sands. It is an amazingly unique and beautiful hotel. Our room had a fantastic view of the bay and the city. The rooftop infinity pool is awesome and the longest and highest such pool in the world. Don’t worry about finding a place to eat; there are 80 restaurants in the Marina Bay Sands complex. It is an excellent, stunningly-beautiful hotel, but very pricey and rightfully so.
label: Positive

Comments: Pool area is cool and we loved the view. Pool staff very friendly.The building itself is very exciting and if you want to enjoy the pool and the surroundings, one night is what we recommend. Thats the one star. Feeling of living there is hectic, noisy and casino mentality. So, it's a stressful environment. But for one night to experience it is ok... Now...They squeeze out as much money as possible. Prices are ridiculous for what you get. I did not mind the high price per room as it was winter break, even if the rooms don't live up to the standard of the price BUT when they cheat on small things that add up extra expenses for a family on top of extreme pricing from the beginning, on top of the service you already paid for, then we give this hotel a MINUS! We booked BED&BREAKFAST,…
label: Negative

Comments: Good location, beautiful garden (Bay Park), great structure.  The roof top infinity pool is the best. From there, the whole downtown skyscrapers will in your camera. Also the views of sky park and roof top bar are also incredible. The hotel service staff are very nice and always will help you. The only reason I do not mark 5 starts since I feel the hotel room is a little bit out of date...our bath room shower head shots water anywhere so we had to put a tower on it.   Anyway, overall it is a nice place to be.
label: Positive

Comments: We booked a room for one night on a recent 8 night trip to Singapore. After staying at Hotel Jen and using their rooftop pool, MBS was not even close to as good. the MBS check in experience was great - busy but we had a sky view deluxe room so were checked via a separate VIP area. The room was massive and the view was great (47th floor). The fittings and finish were a bit worn for such an amazing building. Even the hallway and elevators showed lots of wear (and its a relatively new hotel). We went immediately from our room up to the rooftop pool, walked through the secure pool turnstile gates and then....crap. It was like a dodgy cruise ship with hundreds of people walking around in bath robes all taking selfies. There were no lounge chairs left and every space was crammed with…
label: Neutral

Comments: With the buzz about this hotel, decided to pop in to explore. An early morning flight forced us to reach here around 6 am, and the staffs welcomed us with smile (only reception open in Tower 1 at this time). We were given a temporary pass which gives you access to the highest Infinity pool in the world (located on 57th floor) which is open from 6 am to 11 pm.  The sunrise is an amazing experience, I highly recommend to get in early to catch the glimpse. You can view the whole Marina Bay from here.  The pool is an experience, though the water can be a bit cold in the morning. The city view is something you want to post on your insta. There are towels available near the pool and there is a toilet as well on the 57th pool (though they don't have amenities like shampoo, body wash,…
label: Positive

Comments: i stayed here for 2 nights (with additional 2 nights at Parkroyal on Pickering for more relaxing time). i was glad to try out the full Marina Bay experience -- and of course the pool. However, this place is just too big to feel like a luxury hotel. Much of the time it feels more like being in transit in an airport. For example, when i checked out at 11am it took literally 35 minutes to get my family and luggage down in the lifts, which were jammed full of other departing guests. The pool is similarly packed. It's virtually impossible to get a poolside seat, or even to swim amidst the crowds standing in the water with selfie-sticks.  it's unique, spectacular and worth doing (briefly) but more of an amusement park vibe...
label: Neutral

Comments: This hotel is all about logistics (watch the Netflix special). With the number of people parking, visiting, checking in, checking out, shopping, eating, sleeping, swimming this hotel is impressive in its management of those activities. However, in isolation, there isn't anything too impressive about each part, except for the shopping and swimming.  The room is beautiful, and our gardens view room had a balcony with a great view. We appreciated the checkin clerk upgrading our room for free.   The mall and restaurant are all high end and high prices but beautiful in their own right. We enjoyed walking through them.  But you stay here to access the pool, and they've got that figured out. I'm glad, since otherwise the pool would be slam packed all the time, if non-guests could…
label: Positive

Comments: I've stayed at a lot of hotels and even the best have an issue here or there, but not the Sands  We stayed in a club room facing the city, what a beautiful view.  The hotel was full but never waited more than a couple of minutes at the club room or restaurants, everything thing was so well organized.  The pool a must see.
label: Positive

Comments: Curiosity finally got the better of me, and I stayed at MBS mainly to experience a swim in the rooftop pool.  Non-guests are not permitted, and it's just as well because the pool can be quite congested even without them.  The pool is great of course, very long but not as wide as I had imagined.  If you're staying any length of time at the pool you will of course need to eat and drink.  The prices are a bit of a shock, made worse because they are all "++" prices - I hate that.  But just because you are paying an explicit "Service Charge", don't worry, you will still be presented with space on the bill to add a Tip.  Two cocktails and a plate of very average chips cost $70.  The room was beautifully appointed, with a nice balcony (I didn't realise these are only on the Gardens…
label: Neutral

Comments: If you have the budget, stay here.  If you prefer the city skyline, ask to have a room facing the financial district.  If you prefer nature, ask to have a room facing Gardens by the Bay.  Luxurious, new, modern and spacious rooms.   Exciting events all year round too.  You won't regret it. And best to come when they have nice plays showing within their Marina Bay Sands compounds.
label: Positive

Comments: Fantastic building, fast, friendly and good check-in. Spacious room, clean, great views, The famous infinity pool at the top floor was colder than expected though. Everywhere, great service, good food, efficient elevators.
label: Positive

Comments: This was the first leg of my husbands surprise 50th Birthday trip. We stayed 2 nights and the hotel is very clean and spacious. We had a Gardens by the Bay view from our room. The best bit for me was the infinity pool at the top, it is more of less the whole length of the hotel. Great views over the city etc. Hotel is price, but most places in Singapore are. Would definitely recommend and stay here, just to say you have been as it's such an iconic hotel!!
label: Positive

Comments: For us you can’t visit Singapore without a visit here and we chose to stay here for our three night stopover on our way to Thailand. It was a great choice.  We loved the hotel and the complex and indeed Singapore. We had seen many photos of the infinity pool but none of them did it justice, especially taking in that view at 6am when the city is just lit up beautifully. The view from our room was no less spectacular and the service we received from check in, to room service was outstanding.   The rooms weren’t luxurious but excellent quality all round and breakfast in Club55 was one of the best we have had in any hotel, indeed Club55 was something that really made our stay. If you’re thinking about it, don’t think any longer, just do it! You won’t regret it.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed 3 nights at the iconic hotel. Our room had both harbour and city views. The room was an excellent size. We had breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails included daily. The food and drinks were fantastic whilst enjoying an incredible panaromic view. The infinity pool was breathtaking. The staff were top class. This is the best hotel experience.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for our honeymoon as a stopover before heading back home and it was such a wonderful experience to stay at Marina Bay Sands as it was my first time.   As you check-in, the hotel is very busy and I was amazed how they manage to run the check-in very smoothly. The hotel is connected to the large shopping centre and casino which is full of high-end designer stores. We stayed in the deluxe room facing the spectacular view of the city and we were located high up the level before the infinity pool. The infinity pool at night was truly breathtaking nothing like I've experienced before.   The location of the hotel was excellent as it was central to everywhere as public transport was very easy to get by using the MRT. The Marina Bay was such a wonderful…
label: Positive

Comments: Enjoyed the shopping spree & restaurants in MBS.  Sunday also has a church service in the convention hall.  Authentic Branded goods can be found in MBS.   Professional customer service & great ambience shops.
label: Positive

Comments: The Marina Bay Sands is a well served, well located and iconic hotel in Singapore. I guess is best know for its huge infinity pool on the top of the three main buildings. Price was reasonable within the Singapore luxury range. Room was large and comfortable, very clean and with a great view on the Bay. Only negative factor is that is HUGE and lack of personality and you feel a bit like in a massive bus going on holiday.
label: Positive

Comments: I visited this place as a tourist,not a hotel guest so this review is based on that. No doubt this place is a magnificent structure from the outside but thats where it stops. Inside is quite underwhelming and lacks the WOW factor. Having the check-ins in basically what is a shopping mall is very tacky and having public toilets next to those check-ins is even worse. Along with tourists like myself the whole area was a mass of people shopping or checking in or out...it really is disappointing from the inside. The shops within the complex are the same as you will see in every major shopping centre in Singapore with all the big name (and overpriced) brands occupying space...strangely not many had customers in them
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed at Marina Bay Sands for 3 nights 4 days. We were provided an upgrade for a decent price upon arrival. Its the prime location to stay at. All the attractions are nearby. Merlion and Singapore Flyer and Gardens by the bay are literally walking distance from the hotel. It's 15 mins drive to the sentosa island, 15 mins drive to little india/China town/Mustafa/Orchard street and Clarke Quay.  The biggest attraction of the hotel is it's infinity pool. Loved the pool. Get a city view hotel. We saw the laser and the fountain show from our room itself. Their night club is amazing too. The mall is literally I'm the basement of the hotel.  Entry to the pool and sky deck is only thru individual room key cards. So expect only good crowd there. Breakfast is not included and honestly…
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed here for 2 nights and hotel is about 15 minutes from airport and a 10 minute S$8+ ride from Orchard Road. Great beautiful rooms and well furnished to a high standard and it comes with price. With excellent service from all staff, they're highly trained, very professional and understand the value of looking after customers.  Amazing breakfast buffet and the building is an incredible feat of architecture. The pool has a great view and very windy and scary sometimes. Must be seasonal though but safe and amazing!
label: Positive

Comments: This was our second stay at Marina Bay, our first visit we stayed in a regular room but as we were travelling in a large group for our 10 year anniversary we decided to book 2 two bedroom apartments, Bay Suites and they were AMAZING!!!!  The rooms are elegant, well appointed and so spacious, larger than my house.  Each bedroom has an ensuite and the master has a long hall of cupboards and a dressing area.  The lounge and dining area are spacious, well appointed with a selection of beautiful TWG Tea, coffee (instant and pod) the mini bar was included in our price so we loved drinking the Piper bubbly!  There is also a guests powder room off the lounge.  We had 2 butlers look after us during our stay, what an incredible experience, they delivered us fresh fruit daily, knowing my…
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here during our honeymoon trip to Singapore and we loved it. The rooms are very spacious and the views are amazing. The staff was very friendly and nice which is a huge plus. The highlight is the infinity pool at the rooftop which we loved. Amazing place and we will be back.
label: Positive

Comments: You’re not experience Singapore if you don’t visit this place. A nice place with panoramic view of the city of Singapore plus the the infinity swimming pool is cool area to take good pictures, I think its long enough to reach 100 meters. From the outside, the structure looks stunning specially during golden hours.
label: Positive

Comments: Nice hotel, nice staff, smells good Good swimming pool and nice massage on level 55 Food is yammy Shopping is good. Taxi cheap. Land mark building in Singapore  We lived in the suites. $$$ but worth the $
label: Positive

Comments: its the best thing singapore can offer!!i m nnot sure i would visit singapore again if it wasnt for this hotel!!!now i definitelly wanna go back!!amazing views and amazing pool!!! :O many breakfast options and rooms have huge bathrooms!
label: Positive

Comments: An amazing architecture, it is the sign of singapore, and the location is great for a first time visit in Singapore (especially if it is a short one as ours was, 3 nights only).  The hotel is beautiful, the service is very good, but it is very overcrowded... Not only the hotel guests , but also the daily visitors everywhere. The biggest deception is the crowds at the pool. There is no way you can get a sunbed before 21h at night, the pool is overcrowded with people and their mobile phones and selfie sticks.  The water of the pool is cold (i guess to avoid for people staying too long), it has been very windy every day of our stay. In general it is not a relaxing or enjoyable place you want to stay and spend your holidays. It feels like being in disneyland at Xmas. I think that is…
label: Neutral

Comments: We spent 3 nights here on our way back from Australia to the UK. We had a great room on the 43rd floor. Everywhere very clean and service was good. the roof top pool, bars and restaurants are really what this hotel is all about.... and it is amazing. Expensive here though and probably wouldn't return, only because we can now say that we have "done it", and not due to anything bad about the hotel itself.
label: Positive

Comments: Yes it is expensive, but it is an experience. We got in at night and went straight to the pool on the top deck. Wow.   Great access to Gardens by the Bay and downtown train line.  Food wise can be cheap if you want to be. There is a great Hawker style food court in the attached shopping mall. We had great meals there for two people for less then $20 between us. Breakfast on the pool deck is also cheaper then most places and has an amazing view.  The gym was pretty good for a hotel too.  We had a fantastic view of the Gardens from our room too.  Downtown line under but he hotel will get you easy access to Arab Quarter, Chinatown, Down town etc.
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel itself is an architectural masterpiece no doubt, but the club lounge leaves a LOT to be desired! We stayed in an Orchard suite, purely for the club lounge benefits, club lounges over the world an escape from the noise and somewhere to relax and enjoy a quiet cocktail, plan the next days sight seeing etc. Usually the clientele are well dressed and business travellers, this is not the case at MBS. It is akin to a food court cafeteria, there are kids everywhere screaming, or playing noisy games on ipads etc. There is no class it is just people fighting each other to get to the canapes. The service itself was lovely and the staff all seem quite proud to work there which is nice. If you have kids you might like it, but my idea of a lounge breakfast isn't with an…
label: Neutral

Comments: Was staying at marina bay sand hotel during christmast for 3 days. Modern hotel with amazing infinity pool and observation deck. (But the swimming pool were overcrowded) This hotel are recommended for a one night stay to experience amazing pool etc. Lack of touch or soul. Seems like hotel for bussiness only. The staff appear more focussed on processing rather than serving. A few staff are friendly, but the rest seem do not care about the customer.
label: Neutral

Comments: We were staying in Singapore so we booked this for our last night amazing Checkin in - Dec 29 th  very quick  young man on reception very helpful . Water was handed out as you arrive.  We booked garden room but was upgraded  which was very nice Luggage was taken off us and we were told this would arrive in 15 min it did not but was not much longer we also received note later apologise for this. When we entered room it was city side all 3 of us went wow. Large size room amazing views in Tower 1 . Bathroom was fabulous free standing bathtub  so large and spotless . Beds very comfortable thought room service and mini bar well priced. We went up to spend few hours in affinity pool . Towels are provided nice sun loungers and it was busy but worth it for the view. Think it should be…
label: Positive

Comments: 1. The first thing when you enter is a long line for checking (like a queue if bus stop). This was observed for continuous three days by us. They offer you no sitting arrangement or drinks.  2. For toilet water arrangement which is required by most Indians is not there.  Pro 1. In room dinning by pre arranged trolley is good.
label: Neutral

Comments: We arrived on Christmas Day. We had booked a club view room so we were able to check in through the club check in room and avoid the lines. Yes, it’s true there are a lot of people that walk around the hotel but I never thought it was so crowded that we looked like herds of sheep. Only guests with key cards can go up the elevators and you can’t even go on other floors as your keycard only gives you access to your floor and 55+. The infinity pool is amazing but the water is cold. I never saw the pool crowded like some people have mentioned. They do have a few hot tubs facing the gardens. The room was nice and clean but the bed was hard. My hubby and I woke up every morning with sore backs. No heavenly beds here. For the price of the room you would expect at least a good nights…
label: Neutral

Comments: Spacious, Good city view. Roof top swimming pool. Good place to stay if you want the skyline view. Love to come back for the next stay. Near the city Garden. Superb night view. Many Skyscrapers at nite. Casino below the hotel.
label: Positive

Comments: We arrived at about 10.00 from the airport flying in from Manchester UK. We came on the train to avoid traffic. OMG We have never seen so many people in a hotel reception. We fought our was through the crowds to a reception desk where the queue was quite long I asked,' is this the queue for Club check in' the man behind the desk said 'Yes' after waiting for about 20 mins and the queue not seem to be moving. I asked another man passing the same question, he said come this way took us back through the crowds to a door that said VIP room. We went in a round room with 4 check in desks and some water which by this time was what we needed. after a further 20 mins we got to the desk, checked in which we knew we would not get a room as we were early. You can use the pool area with a…
label: Neutral

Comments: Sheng Long of floor 20th arvo HSK, you a legend mate. He was cleaning our room on floor 20th on tower 2. Everything was on top notch, gave us extra water bottles and teas. Tipped the bloke $8 and he did extra on the next day.  Mate keep up the excellent work, always smiling and asked for a room clean when we saw us going out from the room.  Not gonna post the picture of the extras but thanks a lot.  Coming from Paiza Gold member :)
label: Positive

Comments: Club city view room - great views of the harbor from large floor to ceiling windows, comfy bed - very large! and great space.in the room and bathroom. we had breakfast at spagos on the roof top and lovely sunrise over the straits. the pool was always busy - most people in for selfies (including us!). a great central location by gardens on the bay. light amd sound show at night outside the hotel also- can also see it from the room, although better on the street.
label: Positive

Comments: By far one of the nicest places we have ever stayed!   Don’t just stay in a fancy hotel that has this as the view, spoil yourself & stay here!  We stayed in tower 2 and Lived in the penthouse for the week.   That entitled us to be in the Club 55 (you must stay on floor 55 or above) Where every afternoon you receive complimentary wines, spirits and beer that are matched with an exquisite plethora of canapés.   Our room was turned twice per day, with the finest bathrobes, soaps and accessories.    We were so spoiled but this was worth every cent.  We did go a little overboard in the restaurant on the 1st night but you can travel through the underground passage ways and find some really nice street food!  If you want 1st class then stay here.
label: Positive

Comments: Great Service right from early check in . Club Rooms spacious and well appointed .  Club 55 for Club Room guests was classy ......Chilli Crab , Champagne and Pork Belly !!!!!  Infinity Pool was spectacular .........both during the day as well at night .....open uptill 11 pm and only for hotel guests .   Great restuarants for Breakfast .......Spago on rooftop and Club 55 were both amazing ......ambience ,setting as well as spread .  Ce LeVie Bar & Restuarant on Rooftop was fabulous !!!   You can use the Hotel Gym & Spa for a shower and relax ....even after you check out if your flight is late evening !!  Definitely a must do for a Special Occasion !!!
label: Positive

Comments: This was our second time staying at the hotel after having been a few years back. I was very surprised at the sheer masses of people that come through which has in turn impacted the quality of the experience.   The best customer service we received was at the front desk staff upon entry.   The food options were lovely, however mostly a wait every breakfast.   The security staff were rude and abrasive and there are no comfortable seating available in the lobby, which I dare say is strategic to main traffic flow.   Concierge staff were helpful, and yet again a line.   The pool is worth the entire stay, but good luck getting a clear shot until it’s pool cleaning time.   Would we stay again, yes, purely for that gorgeous pool and that impressive view!! In saying that, I’ve heard…
label: Neutral

Comments: We ,my son and i, stayed in a grand club room on the 14th floor. Check in was fast,waited no more than a minute. Accessing the room was reasonably painless.Room was a great size with small changing room ,large separate bathroom and a bedroom and dining area. We had access to club lounge on 55th floor we champagne and hors doerves. Service was impeccable and views fantastic  Breakfast was also served here,again very impressed  We had a couple of other options for breakfast but did not investigate. The Pool,was again fantastic,stunning views over Singapore and was even better at night when everything was lit up Would highly recommend,not cheap but well worth it. A bucket list moment
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for two nights on the way to Sydney for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The hotel itself is huge, with three towers and a vast lobby. The breakfast at Spago on the 57th floor on Christmas morning as amazing, great food, views and service. Avoid the breakfast on the ground floor, it is busy and the food was very average, some of it cold. The infinity pool is amazing, plenty of sun beds, poolside service is amazing and the views and spectacular. We spent Christmas Day by the pool and it was perfect. Rooms are big we had one with a view of gardens by the bay and one with a city view. All I would say is check in/check our is extremely laborious and long winded, when you get off a long flight from London you don’t want to be standing sorting out the…
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed here for 3 days for my birthday. Rooms were big, beds reeeally comfortable, the view is amazing, staff was helpful and friendly, the restaurants are top and the pool is way better than the pictures.  The rooftop pool made the expense worthwhile and was a great birthday treat. Go in the morning if you want a great sunbed at the pool. People usually don’t spend much time there. The views are spectacular, the location is great. Great vibe, highly recommend it
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here for a week over the Christmas/New Year period, so the hotel was heavily booked. Despite the large number of guests, all staff have been super friendly and helpful, and treated us like we were welcome. We booked two rooms, which I was pleased to find were interconnected - both rooms were very spacious, with comfy beds and very clean. We have a view out to Gardens by the Bay and can watch the light show from our room’s balcony (which was nicer than watching from the Gardens themselves). The pool is spectacular and the pool side meal and bar service is great. We have had breakfast at Spago most mornings - best to get to the restaurant before 8am so as not to line up, but the line moves pretty quickly if you don’t miss the crowd. A beautiful hotel, I would definitely…
label: Positive

Comments: Staying at the Marina Bay Sands is a bucket list item you must tick off. The service is excellent and the rooms are immaculate with all that you need at your fingertips. From walking in and having the curtains open to our view to swimming on top of the world in the infinity pool sipping Singapore slings it is truly a magical place that is well worth the visit!
label: Positive

Comments: We are staying in the city view premier room. Room is huge. My baby have a great time to crawl. Room service was fast when request of ice, water and tea. We can enjoy the water “show” (8pm and 9pm) from our room. Do take note timing to swim as the water is cold (better to swim in a sunny afternoon) for people who drive, they provide a valet service at tower 1 with a charge of $12sgd before tax for 24 hours parking and and unlimited entry during the time Slot. Overall a great experience.
label: Positive

Comments: When you talk about a really perfect hotel with all the amenities and facilities that luxury and normal tourists are searching for,the only hotel comes to my mind is Marina bay sands.This hotel is a huge hotel just like a city.
label: Positive

Comments: Visited this iconic hotel as part of an excursion. Walked through the absolutely massive lobby between the two towers and into the lift and up to the 56th floor. The viewing deck is shaped like a boat and has a 360 degree view of the Singapore skyline. Breathtaking views.
label: Positive

Comments: I came here with 2 days then 3 booked in December.  Our adjoining room wasn't ready for us after we arrived at 3. If you want to pay a lot. We had to spend 1hr20 checking in and out both times. The service is really slow for the money.
label: Negative

Comments: I stayed there about 5 years ago when the pool was just opened and I thought "I need my family to stay here with me in the future".   We went to Singapore for my son's birthday a couple of weeks ago and convinced my husband to stay there again... but it turns out nothing has changed. You can see the pool starting to peel, some of the tiles missing, rooms a bit dated, just painted on top of stains, and it was a bit disapointing, it's like no money has been spent to keep it going, just appearances. Also, too many people in the pool, which has made it to be not as exclusive as it used to be.   View was still amazing and we stayed in the pool as much as we could but also the water was freezing and I got laryngitis so was definitely not the best experience that I was looking for when…
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed for 6 nights in a suite with our 2 small children. This whole trip stay was a. disaster. If you are stressed upon arrival you can be sure you will wish that you only were at that stress level upon departure ! And when you are relaxed upon arrival you will 100% stressed upon departure. The whole stay you will feel like in a busy airport terminal. The hotel let’s everybody in !! Guest or no guests !! So you have to constantly make your way through hundreds of people ... the elevators are only for guests but again be ready to be in packed elevators stopping at 10 floors before you arrive on your floor... this while being stuffed  tgth with guests with wet towels coming down or going to the most ridiculous pool in the world . I must agree the idea of having a pool on top…
label: Negative

Comments: Tasty burgers, ample Supercar parking , pleasant crowd and a Richard Mille outlet in case one decides to indulge , great dining venue to take a dip and cleanly environment for family and friends , definetly a must do in Supercar Singapore
label: Positive

Comments: Iconic building and hotel with views and spectacular destinations within walking distance. The Orchid suite was was massive and comfortable. Despite having more than 2500 rooms, the staff remained attentive, helpful and always obliging. Staying at this hotel alone made Singapore a delight - we will return.
label: Positive

Comments: My first day here. View of Straits of Malacca / The Garden. Spectacular .... BUT this is Just another high priced casino / theme hotel, just like in Vegas. Vegas has a vibrant sexy energy, not this one.   The infinity pool depth is highly disappointing - only about 4 feet. It is FILTHY. Disgusting. Not going back into it.   Too much hype for nothing. Over crowded. Tons of garbage floating at the edge of the pool. While you are trying to enjoy the view, these garbages make it very unappetizing.  Don’t waste your money, unless if you wanna entertain your kid for a night.  There are so many hotels in Singapore, alot less than what you pay for this Bay Sands. Have better pools and restaurants ( again over priced).   Not elegant at all. Noisy kids. Dang!! I regret booking for 2…
label: Negative

Comments: Yes the pool is amazing and that's it. The overall staff is rude, especially the ones at the pool side, asking a cocktail becomes like a fight. I booked 2 adults and 2 children, I paid extra for an upgraded room at checkin, and 5 hours later I had to fight an hour over phone to get an extra bed for children. I've been told that we can sleep all 4 in the same bed (M.Navin told me that)!  As a bonus the morning you have to wait 15 minutes before getting a table for the breakfast. My advice: book a single night to experience the pool and then book another hotel for the remaining of your SG journey.
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed for 2 nights (xmas eve & xmas day). Room was clean with nice decor & spacious with plenty of drawer space. We had a garden view room& the view was breathtaking, especially at night. Infinity pool was beautiful but over crowded. You have to be at the pool early to get a good spot.
