It is nice photo opportunities. Buffet breakfast is nothing special. Spread was common as any other 4-5 star hotels. Skypark entry was free for guests which is nice. Plenty of places to eat at. The food court has heaps of variety & really nice food.
label: Positive

Comments: I have stayed in 5 star hotels that were better, mostly for the staff and the food, but this was an excellent hotel.  The rooftop pool made the expense worthwhile and was a birthday treat to myself. It’s also a great location from which to explore the marina Bay Area.
label: Positive

Comments: Beautiful hotel, we stayed in a two bed bay suite  Had everything. Kids had own bedroom and lounge room in the middle.   Views of the gardens we amazing and could see all the bay.   The breakfast was beautiful and staff very good.  Pick up from the airport through the hotel and they were so helpful.   The hotel inside is very large, prices of wine vary largely between restaurants within the hotel   The pool is still the winner and everytime I visit Singapore I still find myself and the kids in the pool enjoying the views
label: Positive

Comments: This hotel is definitely worth a stay but if you are looking for 5 star service, this is not entirely the hotel for you. We stayed in tower 3.  Drop off and check in were straight forward, however if we wanted our bags delivered to our room that would have been a 20 minute wait! The room was a delux king on the 45th floor with a view of the Bay of Gardens. The rooms are spacious and the view was spectacular, especially at night. This was my 2nd stay here and last time I had a view of the marina and the Singapore skyline. Personally, I prefered the marina view but no real complaints either way.  The infinity pool is spectacular and if we had longer, we would have chilled out longer here. My travel companion had not stayed here, hence the 2nd visit. Why was I…
label: Positive

Comments: Since I always get compliment stays on this hotel, I should write this review with those good things about it.. no no. I’m joking..  Yes.. I got the compliments but I will review it without any related to the compliments as I member of Sand Rewards.   This time, It was peak. Holiday seasons. So crowded. You couldn’t expect much for any outstanding service such as how the concierge delivered your bags to room.   But let me note, that the hospitality service always outstanding even though the hotel was so crowded.   Overall.. I love this hotel.  Will be back after new year.
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel is a sightseeign, worth staying one night to use the pool, the gym and other amenities for guests only. The view is incredible specially if your room is sided to the Garden - Bay. Everything is expensive so plan accordingly
label: Positive

Comments: An awesome place to see whole Singapore with fish eye view. You need to buy tickets from basement. It would cost you around $30-$40 SGD. They will take to the terrace from where you can see whole beautiful Singapore. Take beer & sit on floor & watch the view. And obviously beer is not free. No time limits. Good place to take selfie as well. Staffs are very cooperative & friendly.
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed in this super cool hotel for 2 nights, on 11 floor. There is a beautiful pool on top for just in-house guests. It has amazing outlook, especially at night full of neon lights, a part of a whole complex: Shoppes, gardens by the bay, Merlion statue, Sentosa park... But my staying, not that fair, just so noisy from my room, didn’t sleep enough.
label: Positive

Comments: This is a huge hotel.The views and the staff would get a five stars. I enjoyed looking down on the city from all direction. Wonderful. I was not keen on the crowds of people around the roof pool. It’s all about the perfect selfie and people take them constantly.It was actually very comical but it is one of the most famous iconic places in Singapore so of course it’s to be expected. The rooms were spotless and very quiet. I would not expect anything less from a hotel of this category. I wasn’t blown away. Sorry to be fussy but the toilet seat was not soft closing:-)
label: Neutral

Comments: A Christmas Staycation at the MBS Front desk was great and we got a 49th floor, deluxe room with City View. Room was huge but a bit too empty, would be great if there are more decor. Amenities in the rooms are minimum, quite disappointed but room is clean. Automatic window blind was quite noisy and lack maintenance. For a 5 star hotel, I do expect more especially it cost almost $1000 for a night. Not worth the money.   #marinabaysands #hotel #staycation #mbs #deluxeroom #cityview #christmas #holiday #sg #accomodation #review #travel #singapore
label: Neutral

Comments: We had the pleasure of starting our holiday with a 3 night stay at this amazing hotel. Absolute world class. Can’t say enough good things about it. From the check in, the room, the pool and then also the city. You have to do this at least once in your life. A must for sure
label: Positive

Comments: We only stayed in Marina Bay Sands for 1 night, but it was the best night I had in Singapore. There was so much space, huge bathtub and shower. The infinity pool was beautiful and it was definitely worth the money also the view was breathtaking. The area was great and right in front of the light show. I wish I could rate rate it a 1000,000,00,000,000,000,000,000 stars. Very very very highly reccomended.
label: Positive

Comments: So when you go to check in, they tell you that you have to wait for a few hours and they will e-mail you. When we signed the paper, we notified the receptionist that he wrote the e-mail address wrong and he said that he will change it. Hours later we were still waiting for an e-mail, which never came. I went to ask the front desk if there's any way we can at least pay for an earlier check in as we were exhausted. She told me the room is ready and the bags are already there. So make sure they write your e-mail correctly. After the shower we went upstairs for the infinity pool, but you only find out that you need both keys when you arrive there so if u left ur other key in the room, you have to make another trip back. Breakfast is ok, nothing out of the ordinary. Amazing view of…
label: Negative

Comments: Expensive but something we will never forget. Infinity Pool - wear the bathrobes & Slippers they provide- it’s a real giggle.  Head to the food court - mostly Asian but good value. Loved window shopping-Gucci, Prada out of my budget.  Singapore does Christmas beautifully.  City feel safe & is very clean.
label: Positive

Comments: Of course it's a 5-star property, great location, great service etc etc. But to be honest the ONLY reason I stayed was for the infinity pool access, once I had my fill I switched to Sheraton which I felt was better located in terms of walkability/access to Clarke Quay and LauPaSat. No doubt great luxurious facility and amazing service though!
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here as the hotel is iconic and we wanted to experience the roof top pool ( quite surreal ) The rooms were spacious and we had a great view over Gardens by the Bay. It was a bonus to find a generous sized balcony. The whole complex is massive and we got lost frequently. The lift system is complicated given that the hotel is comprised of 2 towers. The evening light show is spectacular
label: Neutral

Comments: I traveled there with my wife during last March'2018 .It is nice & big hotel in Singapore.Foods are super Delicious. view from sky park  is immaculate. even you not stay in hotel you can go there by purchasing ticket for observation desk.  Highly recommend.
label: Positive

Comments: The room is spacious and with full bay wall glass. One can see the Bay Garden, the Spectra Light show and walk to Casino, Food Court and taxi to every attraction less than $10 Singapore.   The sky infinity pool is best fun for couple and family alike. Plenty of chairs and towels never seem hard to find.  Its little awark to switch elevator at level 34 to reach the pool  at level 57 and then go to Tower 2 down to level 55 for fitness center, sauna and steam room.  It does not offer shuttle to and from cruise terminal or air ports. They order taxi service for guests.  Taxi either give you fixed price in advanced or use meter but very reasonable.  We did not buy breafast but breakfast lines were long suggesting they were good.  Its wifi is good at food court as well.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay is one of the landmarks of Singapore - and worth visiting if you can afford it. Amazing views, luxury rooms, shopping, casino, restaurants, etc.- but not really sure if the price is justified.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed with friends for 2 nights, booked a city and a garden view room so had drinks in one the first night and the other the second - best of both worlds.  Rooms are spacious and comfortable, bed very comfortable. Beware of the mini bar - it is computerised so as soon as you take something out it registers and charges you - not sure what the time scale is but our friends took everything out to cool water and had to go to customer services to get it put right. The foyer is very busy.  Gardens by the bay are easily accessible.  Expensive but a great experience.  Splash out and make sure you are high enough to make the most of the views.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands (MBS) - supposedly the best in S'pore or perhaps in the region. But for those who have experienced true 5-star service will know MBS is just an iconic showpiece offering a skypark and infinity pool with a view. But the hotel is overpriced (even in S'pore standards) and there are many better hotels in Orchard and Marina Bay area that offer 5-star service and creature comforts for more value-for money.  Many things failed to impress me at MBS let me highlight a few, the list can go on:-  1. Service staff don't bother to smile or greet the guests - everyone is so busy, preoccupied with their work that they forget that their primary job is to serve the guests. The servers at the Rise buffet restaurant look overworked, tired to serve the guests. They don't look happy…
label: Negative

Comments: Having a daughter at school in Singapore meant we have been frequent visitors  for several years but have always stayed at the St Regis- which is faultless. However we thought this time we would try somewhere different as my daughter had some friends staying at the same time.  The Marina Bay is a lovely hotel and we had a beautiful room-a Grand Suite with the club. It was however situated looking over Gardens by the Bay on a very busy road and so the doors could not be opened due to noise. While the downstairs is full of tourists, the private areas are quiet with the exception of the pool. If you ever wondered where all the selfie sticks went to retire, look there. Management should ban them in the pool as it’s a joke trying to avoid them. Club 55 is great with the afternoon…
label: Neutral

Comments: I was super excited to stay in MBS due to so much popularity I heard of the hotel. The lobby is grand. The hotel is big, very big, with such a huge inventory of rooms and events happening every now and then, lobby is very busy and buzzing. There are main reception on one side of the tower and then there is another reception on the 3rd Tower. The staff is ok, friendly. I checked and asked for room facing the city, whereas they provided me with much better room of garden by the bay facing.   When i entered the room it was not cleaned, i immediately called the housekeeping and got it corrected. The staff was quick to sort my problem, however, with MBS, I hoped not to face any problem.   Since I stayed at the hotel for the event, the food was part of the banquet. The service and…
label: Neutral

Comments: its has a best location of Singapore and huge, Exterior is better then interior, Great infinite pool  and sky deck. Grand view of Singapore. Food is good rooms are well maintained and service is promising.
label: Positive

Comments: Booked the Orchid suite last year, which had a beautiful layout, with remote controlled blinds and a balcony overlooking  Gardens by the Bay, and the bathroom looking out onto the general CBD/marina Bay area. Rooms were spotless and it was quite a treat getting to stay there.   The only flaw I had during my stay was with the service of one of the bell-hops we’d encountered in the elevator (as we were heading up), who was rather rude to me and my friends and cursed aloud in Mandarin thinking we wouldn’t understand what he’d said. We caught hold of a manager and filed a complaint, and the bell-hop was made to apologise to us following this.
label: Positive

Comments: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights on our way to London from Sydney. It was the start of a long 4 week vacation and it could not have started any better.   We had a beautiful corner room with a balcony overlooking the park and ocean.   Club 55 was the best value ever!  The staff were soo helpful and in particular a big shout has to go out to... Gina and all the others at Club 55  Thanks all.
label: Positive

Comments: Such amazing Staff went over the usual to help me welcome my daughter with a birthday greeting. No extra cost either. Amazing. Thanks to Liza on the front desk. Wish all hotels ere this helpful. I'll definitely come back here next time.
label: Positive

Comments: We are a family of five and staying at the marina bay sands was the highlight of our stopover in Singapore. The infinity pool with its views across the city is amazing and we were surprised that there was so much space to get a bed at any time of the day. The service and choices of restaurants nearby especially at the “shoppes” in the mall is numerous. Check out the deals the hotel as with restaurants in the shopping centre as we got free deserts and 20% of our food bill.
label: Positive

Comments: Firstly, a special mention to Joanne in Premium Services for making our stay extra special and memorable!  We enjoyed three nights at the Marina Bay Sands earlier this year, and our two sons, both under 10yo, are still talking about it!  Club Room - We paid extra for a Club Room so we'd have the extra space to accommodate a family of four.  Joanne very kindly ensured we had a room with two Queen beds, which was simply perfect. The room was spacious, very clean and modern, and not at all cramped with the four of us. It looked out behind the hotel towards the rest of the city, and twice every evening we got to enjoy a water fountain show on the water directly below/behind the room, set to music with lights.  We took advantage of the included afternoon tea at the Club Lounge, but…
label: Positive

Comments: Where do I begin?  Two years ago, we had an eight hour layover in Singapore.  We decided to spend it touring the magnificent and unique Gardens by the Bay.  At the Gardens, I saw this structure unlike anything I'd ever seen before.  I found out it was a hotel, and resolved, should I ever return to Singapore, to stay there. Opportunity arose and we booked a club room for a five night stay.  I could easily have doubled that if I could have afforded it.  Our room was on the 45th floor, overlooking the bay.  The view was stunning day and night, and not only could we see the Marina Bay light show from our room, in some ways, it was the best view of all (and we tried six different locations.) The room was VERY large with very comfortable king-sized bed and pillows.  Great roomy…
label: Positive

Comments: From the moment we stepped in it was wonderful experience to choose our stay at Marina Bay. Breathtaking views of Singapore from the infinity pool and from the room is not to miss. The rooms are huge and the services are top notch. It has got lot of resturants in the hotel and a huge shopping centre attached to it. Will definitely stay here during my next visit.
label: Positive

Comments: An excellent, comfortable and well run hotel with an amazing roof area including the delightfil infonity pool.
label: Positive

Comments: We booked one night at the hotel as a final treat to ourselves after our Asian cruise. The positives: - accommodating staff on check in. I wasn’t feeling at all well when we checked in so the receptionist swapped our room so that we could check in immediately - attentive staff at the roof top bar who offered numerous remedies as a pick me up  - if you are above the 40th floor the views are amazing.  The negatives:  - Singapore is one of the most expensive places in the world. The hotel is on another level of expensive...  - the extra you pay for this hotel is for the infinity pool and nothing else. It is no more luxurious then any other nice hotel we’ve stayed in  - the hotel is a tourist attraction and there are literally thousands of people milling around at any one time. It’s…
label: Neutral

Comments: It's always worth it to splurge for the infinity pool here. It is absolutely amazing. The hotel itself last time I was here I thought the room was ok. This time we were in a slightly different deluxe room with a beautiful view of the gardens with a balcony. The room was great and the service fantastic the moment we walked in. Can't think of anything negative. Would recommend to everyone to splurge for even just one night!
label: Positive

Comments: Took the 56 floors to the rooftop piazza of the Marina Bay Sands, stunning views of Singapore and the surrounding harbour. Excellent viewing area, with shop and bar available, definitely a must visit stop when in Singapore.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at Marina Bay Sands for one night on the 14th December in a Grand Club Room. Overall it was a great stay, our room was large with floor to ceiling windows. The room was also split into bedroom, powder room/wardrobe and full bathroom. The staff were efficient and the roof top pool was great although busy. We had afternoon tea and canapes at club 55 and this was great, the selection was enough to graze over. We had breakfast at Spago on the roof and the selection was great.   Overall we had a great time. I feel that you pay the extra due to it being Marina Bay Sands. Just a tip for people looking to stay here, if you only have a visa/mastercard debit card like we do they do advise that it can take some time to get your security deposit back to you so they prefer you to…
label: Positive

Comments: I honestly would not recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Singapore. The only thing myself and two children loved was the Infinity Pool. The rooms are very average, they don’t feel clean the pick and choose if it suits them for a 12 and 15 year old to be an adult, they upgrade you without asking to a city view room with 2 single beds, very well knowing you will need another bed, you ask the question and they reply sorry you will need a roll away bed which will cost $160 per night plus tax, well sorry that wasn’t happening the room cost enough as it was. The staff had no personality and very rude, very hard to get any sort of advice or information from anyone. I think they need to really look at staff people skills and accommodating families with better bed configuration,…
label: Negative

Comments: It was an amazing treat (my 2nd time) to be able to stay at this Singapore landmark {MARINA BAY SANDS} for a few days.   I had a decent room with the fantastic view of the Singapore Strait water.   The top of the hotel has the famous infinity pool which is an experience, for sure. The views are incredible. There was a light breeze up there, palm trees that one can find shade under, and also hot tubs.  During the day, it was quite busy in the pool.  Most people in the pool are taking selfies or group pictures at the edge of the infinity pool. The selfie stick is alive! It gets pretty old after a while and I wish they had an area set aside for picture taking, so swimming would be possible.  There are lots of restaurants in the hotel and adjacent mall but they are all VERY…
label: Positive

Comments: Very good room with fantastic views over the bay. Roof pool on 57th floor very spectacular, and split to 'adult' and 'family' areas works well. Despite very large size staff very friendly and personable. Expensive but spectacular. There are many other good hotels in Singapore but it is worth it at least once for the experience.
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed in this hotel for 2 days. Strategically located. The hotel offers high standard of services, room and amenities. Huge room. Great view. Staff are very well manner and trained. Mall, casino, mrt and attractions are on your door step. Definetelly will come back. Love the place!
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed here for two nights as a surprise for part of my husband's 40th birthday trip. The hotel is amazing from the minute you arrive and you definitely do not want to leave . . . WE WILL BE BACK!!! The hotel is huge and is one to be visited, I can't put the size of it into words. Reception was very busy but moved quickly and you are offered drinks whilst waiting. RJ Domingo checked us in and upgraded our rooms, lovely addition to the second part of our trip and we were extremely grateful. Our room was amazing and had incredible views. One of the main reason to visit here was for the amazing pool. The views were not to be missed. You can only use it if you stay here, which is a good thing. Even when it rained the pool was still in use and everyone was still happy and having fun.…
label: Positive

Comments: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Marina Bay Sands. The staff were so nice and accommodating. The place was lovely, clean and tidy. We had cute little origami animals on the bed each day. The view from the 47th floor was gorgeous and we loved that it was so close to the Gardens. Can’t fault this place really.
label: Positive

Comments: Having wanted to treat ourselves to a stay at Marina Bay Sands hotel (MBS) for a number of years we finally had the opportunity when a special occasion arrived. We stayed for two nights in a Grand King Club Room (41st floor) with stunning views over the marina and access to Club 55. The room was massive and extremely well appointed. The difference for us though were the amazing staff. From check in, luggage handlers, room attendants and reception / wait staff. They were the most friendly, attentive and patient hotel employees we have experienced. They made the entire stay the best hotel experience we've had. Little touches such as rose petals in the bathtub to topping up your drink as soon as it was empty made our stay memorable. Following an early arrival, and without…
label: Positive

Comments: While we stayed here for only one night, we took advantage of everything that Marina Bay Sands had to offer. First off, the service is one of best I've seen or been around. The amenities of the hotel is really top notch. Next, everyone know's about the infinite pool at the top. A heated pool with a stunning view of the harbor and city. Then our room had all the wonderful perks but the view of the garden was amazing. We were able to watch the Christmas musical light show which added to an already amazing experience. Finally, the mall and restaurants within Marina Bay Sands was amazing. You can stay within the confines of Marina Bay Sands and be completely intent.   While the price may be up there, I'd definitely recommend this location. To experience the luxuries of the hotel is…
label: Positive

Comments: Excellent views over the water from top floor. Head up before dusk for the light show and drinks. $20 for a lift ticket to the top floor entitles you to one drink which comes with nibbles and an awesome view. Limited lounge- type seating. Interesting up market shopping on lower levels
label: Positive

Comments: I heard so much about this hotel, had seen it in commercials, movies, television; had several friends mention how they dreamed of staying there, was told it was 5 star....after all of that I probably set myself up for the slight disappointment I felt. First, the hotel is massive, overwhelming  crowded yet somehow was organized chaos! The staff managed the steady flow of incoming and outgoing guests seamlessly....I honestly don’t know how they did it. Kudos to them!!  The room, once we entered was large but felt a bit dated; possibly because I’d just come from the Park Hyatt Bangkok where every detail was so well thought out and the architecture, impressive. I’d expected at minimum the same from Marina Bay Sands but was met with a bit less :(. The bright side, outside of the…
label: Neutral

Comments: I think my family have a great stay. It was centrally located and it was near garden bay which was very convenient. The room was also big and tidy. Officers were all friendly and helpful. No complimentary parking thou. A fix rate of $8+.  Great stay!
label: Positive

Comments: I booked this hotel for one night following our Singapore roundtrip cruise in Asia.  I was expecting a huge, impersonal hotel where I could get a great selfie at the pool.  Wow was I wrong.  First, the check in staff was wonderful.  They made me feel immediately at home.  Very warm and personal.  Second, once you are in the towers, it is very quiet and does not feel like a Vegas style hotel.  Three, the room was so much better than the pictures.  Really great room.  Four, all staff throughout the resort are wonderful.  If I return to Singapore, I will definitely stay here again.  Convenient to the mall with many restaurants.  Great views of the Garden by the Bay and the ocean.  Ultra clean rooms, great service.  What a wonderful surprise.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed for 3 nights and were given a room on the 19th floor, tower 3. Check in was very quick and the service was great. Our room had a large balcony with views over the gardens.   My only niggle with the hotel is the lift set up. Tower 3 has two sets of lifts, we needed to transfer at level 34 to change lifts to reach the rooftop. This meant a wait on level 34 and usually very busy lifts, especially at peak times.  The rooftop was spectacular. The views were amazing. The pool was busy but not as crazy as others have described.  We ate at a number of the hotels restaurants and they were very good, especially Spago! Overall, I would recommend the MBS and would stay here again.
label: Neutral

Comments: We had a fantasic room in 43rd Floor with a view over the whole Marina. A spectacular view I have to say. The pool on 57th Floor is a great experience looking directly from the edge of the pool into the Marina.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed atMBS only for the night to check out the Infinity pool and relax after two months of backpacking. We arrived at around 11am and they checked us in right away for no extra charge. The room was super comfortable, had an amazing view and had everything we would need. The location is amazing, an MRT station in the lobby and buses. This hotel is a must stay in Singapore.
label: Positive

Comments: It is very clean, staff are prompt and friendly, Service is good for a 5-star hotel. Infinity pool is awesome, with a good view below. Only thing is that the pool is usually crowded. Suggest you get to the pool in the early morning to enjoy the sunrise before the hustle & bustle of the mornings start.
label: Positive

Comments: In Singapore, you must stay at Marina Bay Sands. There is everything: the location is great ( close to everything, the best town attractions), good Service, spectacular view of the city sky line from the pool, besides a shopping Mall, cassino, great restaurants. What else do you need?  We had great time at MBS, the staff was very helpful, specially the concierge Leonard.  We’d stay there again, for sure!
label: Positive

Comments: What a beautiful hotel to spend the holidays especially going to the Infinity Pool. You can see the whole Singapore and beyond. Our room was magnificent with a spectacular view. The folded towels were so cute like a stuffed animals welcoming us. As for the bath and toilet area it would be great if they would add a bidet. House keeping staff were very nice. Definitely we would love to stay again.
label: Positive

Comments: Me and my wife stayed at this property in November this year. I must say, everything about this place is spectacular except the check in process which is time consuming. They hardly have two check-in counters with minimal staff. Considering the price you pay to stay at this property, the amount of time you spend to check-in itself is too much. We managed to check-in by 2.45 pm despite reaching there by 1.00 pm. The total number of rooms to the check in counter ratio is just not right ! I guess they should work on this because of the fact that most of the people come to stay for only one night to check the famous bucket list item "The Infinity Pool".
label: Neutral

Comments: Firstly, Singapore is beautiful! We called in to Marina Bay Sands approx 10.30am to drop off our luggage so we could explore until check in. Once we approached the counter they said we were able to check in now! There were 3 of us so we had to wait for a rollaway bed (the rollaway bed was comfortable but took the elegance a way from the experience) while we were waiting we stood by the window by the elevator. The view of the city was amazing! We weren't even in the room yet and we were all so excited!  Once entering the room everything was amazing. The bathroom set up made you feel fabulous. The bed was comfortable. We had a view of the gardens and the harbour. Both Amazing during the day and night. Once settled we needed to go up to the pool. Everyone needed their keycard to…
label: Positive

Comments: First class hotel. Turned up at 8:30am from a flight that arrived early. Staff found us an available room immeditely at no extra charge.  Service as A++++ So close to everything and the views were amazing. Great vibe in the roof top bar
label: Positive

Comments: very big hotel i would say its the heart of singapore with beautiful architecture.book early your rooms for cheaper rates.mrt is available just inside the mall and easy to head to gardens bythe bay.many meterd taxis available just outside the hotel
label: Positive

Comments: This is certainly the best hotel i’ve stayed in quality in service. Upon our arrival from changi airport, we had VIP check-in in a private and quitet office. Our room was cleaned 3 times a day and towels changed, without asking. In-room food 24h is really good. Rooftop pool is amazing and they have the friendliest staff ever. Cleaniest hotel and city i’ve visited.
label: Positive

Comments: We visited Singapore and had to experience the marina bay sands to see what all the guide about.  When booking, there so many options is hard to decide. I chose to pay a little more for rooms on upper level, with two beds.  The rooms are a great size for a Std room and the city view was amazing as it over looks the water/ river. At night with the city lights and the boats on the water and the merlion makes for a great view. We were in room 3193 and think it was the best location. We saw all the above from room and from passage window then gardens by the bay. The restaurant, spago, at the pool was amazing. Litchie gin and gormert burger and spring rolls were delicious. Obviously the infinity pool was a must see and was a great thrill. Dec is a rainy month, so there were showers…
label: Positive

Comments: This is a first class hotel in the world, with excellent hospitality and excellent hospitality and accommodation. This is a great location that allows for sightseeing in the city and a wealth of atractions around the hotel. The hotel has countless restaurants of various levels and plenty of attractions within the hotel such as shops and cafes. The hotel has one of Bracha's wonderful attractions, which are located on the roof of the hotel, allowing for recreation and view of the city's surroundings, while providing service of food and drink while providing privacy. Summarizing one of the hotels we aspire to return.
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed at this hotel in a bay view club room on the 41st floor. Our whole experience was awesome from start to finish and it was well worth the price paid. Right from our experience at check in to our departure, the hotel exceeded even our highest expectations. The room itself was terrific. We often book suites, but decided not to on this occasion. However, the club room was so big it was virtually a suite anyway. The view of the bay from our room was spectacular. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.
label: Positive

Comments: Visit Singapore's most iconic hotel for the world's largest rooftop Infinity Pool, award-winning dining, and a wide range of shopping and so on. Dont forget to take a sea boat and enjoy the very lovely view at night!
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel has everything, amazing restaurants, shopping mall, casino and an amazing infinity pool looking over Singapore city. Even if not staying here visit the rooftop bars and restaurants, although pricey worthwhile for a special occasion or even just the breathtaking views. $20sgd to go to the top which can be put towards a drink. The structure itself is an engineering masterpiece.
label: Positive

Comments: Overall, our stay at Marina Bay Sands Singapore is ok. My only suggestion is the toilet should have a bidet for those people (like me) who wants to wash with water after # 2. :) But the staff and facilities are great.
label: Positive

Comments: Driving from Woodlands going to the hotel was impressive as there were plants and greeniries along the streets but as I got closer to the hotel it’s more of buildings and it was humid at that time. I came into the hotel and the doorman and porter were very friendly and helpful in spite of the busyness of the place. The Lobby was crowded full of tourists, some were checking out and I got confused where to lined up, staff standing there and as I queued up with my luggage I was told to leave my luggage I should have listened to the porter to leave my luggage with him but I didn’t as I wanted to check in first, I think the porters were more organised 😊. As I waited for my turn to be served I was offered a bottle of water which I accepted with gusto as at this moment I am already…
label: Neutral

Comments: I visited Singapore in September 2018 and while I was their a goal of mine was to stay at the marina bay sands. The hotel lives up to all its hype as far as customer service and excellence. Shopping and the restaurant where all top notch but I don’t think I’m going to surprise many people by revealing that the highlight of my stay was the infinity pool. The pictures/ IG PHOTOS don’t tell the entire story. So basically even if it’s for a night I recommend staying here to enjoy all the amenities but the pool is a show stopper!!
label: Positive

Comments: Had a short stay and truly enjoy it. Book the premier city view room. A good view of Singapore City Business District. Day view and night view are excellent. Love the room. Bed is comfy. Below the hotel had many shopping outlets to shop about.
label: Positive

Comments: It’s a definitely must stay when you visit Singapore. Beautiful 360 view of Singapore, infinity pool, the bar was ok and really expensive $35 for a cocktail. Other than that it was worth it. The room was nice and big and beautiful city view.
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed for 8 nights. The service was brilliant very exciting place to be. Had a suite and the breakfast afternoon tea and from 5 to 7 canopies and drink with amazing views. The staff always remembered your name. The gardens by the bay easy to reach. If your a shopper then your love the shopping centre under the hotel.
label: Positive

Comments: Surely a bucket list property given the famous infinity pool overlooking the city.  Aside from that the hotel excels at providing a great experience despite having an insane number of people staying there.  Clean rooms, nice amenities, pool staff constantly tending to the cleaning of the pool, very accommodating check-in staff, proximity to the gardens out back, plenty of dining options, and plenty of feet on the ground to gladly attend to all your needs.  Pricey perhaps, but in this case you get what you pay for.  Despite the crowds, somehow the MBS property is able to deliver on the promise.
label: Positive

Comments: If I were to summarize a place as "Shut up and take my money!" this hotel is it. Conveniently located next to the Supergrove and other attractions, unbeatable views of Singapore, impeccable service and amenities. And that infinity pool! Worth every penny. My husband and I stayed 4 nights and loved coming back to the hotel after our daily excursions.
label: Positive

Comments: Treated ourselves to 1 night of our 3 night Singapore break in this iconic hotel. It completely dominates the Singaporean skyline. I have always wanted to stay here and it didn't disappoint. It's superbly located near MRT stations too.  It's very similar to hotel / resorts in Las Vegas. Definitely has the wow factor.    We were in Singapore for 3 days and we spent 1 day around Marina Bay Sands Hotel and in the Gardens area.We obviously spent a few hours in the rooftop infinity pool both in afternoon and 10 pm'sh which is astounding and worth paying to stay for 1 night just to get access to the pool. The unparalleled view and people watching around the pool is a spectacle in itself. Also as a guest you get free entrance in the viewing platform in level below swimming pool. The…
label: Positive

Comments: Hands down the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Where to begin?!   Check in was swift and professional. I was queuing for about a minute & the receptionist apology for the delay. Good start. She was very nice while being efficient and talked us through our stay.   The room had a beautiful view overlooking the Gardens of the Bay. The room was spotless and flawless in every way.   The infinity pool is of course the big attraction and beware that there is both a kids and adult section if you want a little more quiet time. The pool sells itself but there is more to this fabulous hotel than the pool.   We had room service one night and it went as follows: a lady rang to ask me to open the door to allow the room service tray to enter the room. When I opened the door he asked for…
label: Positive

Comments: Stayed here for the night following a cruise and prior to flying back to the UK. We had a suite on the 39th floor with views across the city, which were breathtaking! The room was pure luxury, spacious, very comfortable bed and first-class bathroom. The hotel and complex is excellent and it’s very true that you get what you pay for. I would highly recommend treating yourself and staying here for your visit to Singapore. The whole property oozes class and it’s worth it just to take a dip in the highest infinity pool in the world where the views are amazing! Staff are super efficient and cant do enough for you. Go on...book it, you wont regret it, I promise!
label: Positive

Comments: The only downside is that you are unable to access the pool deck side unless you are a guest. This Skypark was beautiful and the views are remarkable. Make sure you buy your ticket online so you won’t end up queuing twice for the ticket and elevator. The photo they take of you before going up is a bit expensive, but it is of good quality and it comes with a huge frame and free keychains. Try the soft serve ice cream while you’re up it’s worth it.
label: Neutral

Comments: we stay on the 49 floor with view of the gardens,the food was very nice,plenty to eat and drink,all free,and i got a very nice birthday cake free to.the swimming pool was very nice to a bit cold.the view from the top of the hotel is out of this world,we cant wait to go back again.
label: Positive

Comments: This structure is, by far, the most iconic building in Singapore, no doubt. I was fortunate enough to stay here with my sibs for a couple of nights courtesy of my bro-in-law. The room we stayed-in had 2 queen size beds, a spacious toilet & bath area, and a balcony overlooking the Botanical Garden. Interior design is typical of any upscale hotel, quite simple, nothing extraordinary but nice nonetheless. Simple is always best. The room is well-equipped with all the necessities expected of a 5-star hotel and sleep comfort is satisfactory. The most sought after amenity of the hotel would most probably be the Skypark swimming pool, suspended 191 meters above ground and is the longest elevated pool with a span of 146 meters. Hotel guests get a free pass using their room key card hence…
label: Positive

Comments: Our stay of one night here was just perfect!  Amazing staff, pure luxury in all the points!   Recommend the bar/bistro of the pool - delicious food and excellent service!  Please be preared that for a “light” meal you will pay for 2 pax. Minimum $100.00.
label: Positive

Comments: Hi there. This hotel looks amazing from the city. Roof top pool, which is very famous now. When opened, it was well priced approx $us 200 per night. Now you are paying double that!very pricey for what it is. Guests have access to pool for free.but non guest can come up for the day and use to pay which is approx 20 bucks. When i was there it was very busy and security was very strict. I would not stay there again for the askijg price.i would rather stay at Raffles or similar
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed one night, so as to have easy access to the gardens. Its impressive for its facilities - restaurants, bars, pool, views, rooms and staff. It is a little on the expensive side but then so is anything similar and it is Singapore. You have to go at least once, so we can tick this one off our list.
label: Positive

Comments: The view from the roof is amazing. The rest was a bit disappointing. The hotel has something like 2,500 odd rooms and it operates as such. I stayed once and that is enough for me. The Vegas-like hotel model does not work for me but it certainly works for others. I’ll put a tick in the expensive experience column.
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed at Marina Bay Sands in  the Orchid Suit, which provided us with views of the City, Bay and Marina. Unbelievable!  Club Lounge is in Tower 2, Level 55. Can also access it from Tower 3 Level 57 Roof top pool, and take elevator to floor 55.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the MBS during our stay in Singapore and were pleasantly surprised with the impeccable service throughout our stay. If you’re staying in one of their various types of suites, you can ignore the sometimes growing chaos of groups of people  in the lobby, and bypass it all together. We were whisked away to be checked in and no sooner were on our way to enjoying our trip. The Marina suite was excellently appointed and the staff through the entire stay was beyond exceptional. Everything was carefully catered to, and the staff was happy to help cater to anything you might possibly need.   The grounds of the property are massive, from the rooftop infinity pool, to the sprawling mall (and casino if you fancy that), to the illustrious gardens. Despite their grandiose we…
label: Positive

Comments: When you see the crowd at the entrance and when you are getting through the annoying check-in procedure you cannot imagine how this hotel can ever justify the price and meet 5-Star expectations. Though, as soon as you are in the elevator and separated from the "mall-crowd" this hotel can offer an experience that amazingly wonderful.
label: Positive

Comments: It is rare that a hotel becomes a significant landmark of a city/country and MBS stands firmly atop in this short list. The multi-billion-dollar design is impressive; the staff are professional and courteous; the views are just amazing. We were on our honeymoon trip from the far away Canada and were lucky enough to get an early check-in and a very spacious suite with the wonderful Gardens by the Bay view. We were also provided with some decorations and candy - the gesture was very much appreciated. Not giving 5 starts as in my personal opinion, the hotel lacks personal touch (which is very hard to do in such a large property) and even though the hotel is not old by any stretch of imagination, more techy stuff would have been appreciated as would an outlet for a blow-drier in one…
label: Positive

Comments: 110% enjoyed our 6 day holiday. Great location, awesome view from the 46th city view floor. Good size room, although would have thought that the TV would have been better in the lounge desk part of the room, rather than in front of bed.  B/fast at Adrift and Rise restaurant was a good way to start the day. Room Service AAA+++. Infinity Pool could have been a tad warmer (would have thought the day temperature would have had an impact?) my 3rd time in Singapore, so much has changed over the last 6 years, just about a new city...and watch out for the MRT traain doors as they close fast without much warning...
label: Positive

Comments: Very Nice Rooms.  The pool up top with the view of Singapore is Superb.  Our suitcases were damaged by poor handling from the cruise we had just taken.  The staff at Marina Bay Sands were very nice to offer us their spare suitcase.  ( It was a repaired suitcase from their storage ).  Marina Bay has its own mall and best of all the Food Court.  The Food Court is a great place to grab a meal.  The Mall is a nice place to shop Luxury Items.  On of our Amiga’s we travelled with was so happy that she was able to purchase a particular hard to find bag strap at the Louis Vitton Store.  We found the conecting bridge from Marina Bay Sands to Gardens by the Bay very convenient.  Love the awesome views of Singapore from this place.
label: Positive

Comments: Great place to stay in Singapore. Immaculate, great service, close to the heart of everything. Connected to a big shopping centre where there are loads of good restaurants or a short walk from town. You can even get a boat. Only complaint would be its size. It is huge and perhaps a little impersonal.
label: Positive

Comments: Our family Of 2 adults with 2 kids (aged 9 and 10) stayed at Marina Bay Sands in October and thought it was very over rated.   Be warned, you are just a number in what appears on be a well oiled machine that comes to a halt every now and then. It’s a massive hotel (we knew beforehand)  and we felt the vibe was cold, unfriendly and very impersonal but that’s to be expected in such a huge establishment.   For example: there were long queues at checkin, our luggage was lost within the hotel and it didn’t make it up to the room for a couple of hours, our two interconnecting rooms (family rooms) weren’t ready for 2 hours after official checkin time, and our family got gastro badly (we only ate at the hotel over 2 nights, who knows if it was the food, the pool or just an unlucky…
label: Neutral

Comments: Great place to stay when visiting. Cozy room with the best city or gardens view. Very easy check in/out process.Awesome Infinity pool at the top maybe a bit crowdy but unforgettable. Can't wait to go back!
label: Positive

Comments: We decided to stay at marina bay sands as my wife was adamant she wanted to go here the moment we were planning our asia trip.  we decided to leave it for the end of our asia trip on the way back to the UK.  the hotel is iconic and as you are driving to the hotel you can see it from the distance and it gets bigger and bigger as you get closer. when you arrive you have to bend your head to see how high it is :).   as we were club room we had a seperate check in area. in the main foyer area there are like 15 checkin desks next to tower 1. but right on the end there is the entrace from club and suite guests. its a nice experience as you dont have to queue you get a ticket and take a seat and wait to be called. enjoy a tea/ coffee drink while you wait.  we were in tower 2 on the…
label: Positive

Comments: Booked a premier king room for 3 adults. Everything is what you would expect from a top hotel. Clean, spacious, lovely sheets pillows, gown, slippers etc. Bathroom was enormous and plush! From reading other reviews check-in was not as bad as we expected. We checked in early and went exploring until our room was ready, we received an email when we could access our room. The pool......amazing! Tricky to get a seat on a sunny afternoon but we were lucky and people were leaving as we arrived. Everyone in the pool wants a photo near the edge with the view behind.... as did we.  Had breakfast up at the Spago restaurant each morning, we had a choice of 3 restaurants but we wanted the view. Food and service were both brilliant. Bar drinks anywhere in the marina area was…
label: Positive

Comments: Decided to stay here to see what the fuss was about.  Its a juggernaut of a hotel and once you have mastered the lifts and find your room its ok. Yes the views are stunning. The higher you go the smaller the room. Its very vegas  if thats your thing then your love it. Pool is the place to be but you wont be able to swim in it,just take selfies. Ive done it i won't go back. It a bit fur coat no knickers!!!
label: Neutral

Comments: We were there for our anniversary celebrations.So the management arranged cake for us and decorated the room as well.The main attraction of the hotel is infinity pool. It is an once in a lifetime experience. The rooms are good but do not exceed expectations. Overall our visit to the hotel was fantastic.
label: Positive

Comments: Booked it for 1 night to experience the infinity pool, had room on 50th floor with amazing harbor view. The hotel is huge and has all you need. The infinity pool is busy but you always find a chair to relax and space for a swim and nice picture. Expensive but a must on your bucket list
label: Positive

Comments: Enjoyed our stay in Marina bay sands.The view from the room was amazing,we could just sit near the huge window and see the light show at the plaza from our room.The size was the room and bathroom was good.The staff were very helpful and courteous. The best part of the stay is the infinity pool which joins all the three towers and it's huge.One can spend the entire day in and around the pool. It's open from 9am to 11pm so the view is the evening with all the lights is breathtaking.It also has jacuzzi. The pool is accessible to only the hotel guests so one needs the key to enter the area. The lobby is also huge with 3 towers , very crowded but well managed. The pricing is expensive.. The hotel is connected to the casino,malls , restaurants and gardens of bay is in the walking…
label: Positive

Comments: Nice and spacious room, fantastic service, great view from room, within walking distance to the mall next to the hotel with variety of shops and restaurants.  Very close to tha gardens by the bay where you can stroll along the park in the morning and enjoy the sunrise.
label: Positive

Comments: The infinity pool as well as the room view are great. We had booked a Skyview room at the 43rd floor but it was full of humidity!Unacceptable for the amount we paid! Rooms need refurbishment asap. You can see that the hotel suffers from humidity in the photo taken on the corridor...
label: Neutral

Comments: The reason why Marina Bay Sands always worth it for your vacation is because they have the value and perfect services. the staff was amazing. profesional and always helpfull, they will assisted you for whatever you need.
label: Positive

Comments: From arrival to departure the staff of this hotel could not have done more to provide us with exceptional service. We stayed four days and had paid extra for a room on 46th. floor, which had amazing views over the city and a fantastic view of the twice nightly "Laser light, fountain and music" show, which displays at 08.00pm and 09.00pm each night in the harbour. Infinity pool with plenty of sun-loungers and open air restaurant on the 57th floor are a great place to unwind after a day in the city. We did have cause to complain to the Concierge about some misleading signs within the hotel, which caused us great inconvenience and whilst he accepted our grievance was completely justified he pointed out that whilst it would require a senior management decision to remedy the…
label: Positive

Comments: It was such a beautiful stay. From reception all the way to the restaurants. The infinity pool was amazeballs 😍 the food was delight full and the view was breathtaking. Thank you very much for great vacation
label: Positive

Comments: We arrived the hotel with wheelchair at 12. Room is ready upon arrival which is very nice. However, the nightmare starts when we returned from whole day sightseeing. Room is located on 2nd floor which is on top of the lobby bar. We can hear the live music downstairs till 2am. And window is facing highway which means we are surrounded by loud bar music and traffic noise. What makes more horrible is balcony exactly located on top of the bar kitchen. Smoke kept coming up to our room.   After sleepless night, we have to go to front desk for changing a quiet room. Without going to our room, the front desk staff seemed already understand the problems of this room. I cannot believe a five star hotel would provide this kind of room to a wheelchair guest.   Only upside of this hotel is…
label: Neutral

Comments: What a wonderful hotel ,swift check in , suite ready , awesome views , fantastic facilities for business events etc. One of the best shopping malls attached to the hotel I have seen anywhere in the world.  The only down side I do have is the amount of people just lazing around the foyer becomes like a bus station of people doing nothing. Other than that once through the hordes its fantastic. The rooftop swimming pool and restaurant is totally amazing
label: Positive

Comments: The hotel is really amazing, it is near to all sightseeings.The service is very good especially the Skypark- Dennis is very good and polite, always trying to help, very nice guy. The check-in was very fast. I recommend the breakfas at the Skypark although in all the restaurants the food was very good, good variety and quality. If you go to Singapore take a tour with a boat is wonderful. Visit the garden by the bay.
label: Positive

Comments: We saw this hotel in the process of being built 8 years ago and it is such a monolith on the Singapore landscape that you must visit at least once which is what we did and were not disappointed. The hotel is terrific in every aspect combined with the usability and spectacular views from the pool to the shopping, entertainment and casino I found the Marina Bay Sands to be quite special. I loved the automation of the curtains opening on entry to expose the beautiful garden by the bay and busy harbour beyond. A little on the expensive side however well worth it except for the outrageously expensive laundry service I was well and truly pleased with my stay at MBS.
label: Positive

Comments: It's huge, it's crowded, we queued almost as long as in airport to check-in, it's impressive modern architecture from outside, room was spacious, nice, clean, well equipped with jaw-dropping views over the city............but only reason why we really stayed here is rooftop swimming pool and probably partly because of the views from the room as we chose Sky City view room. This is the place to experience once per life and you should experience it as there is no any other place like swimming pool at Marina Bay Sands. On the other hand when we visit Singapore again for the same price we will find luxury place where we feel more welcome, more expected, experience more attention and maybe someone even will remember our names at the reception.
label: Positive

Comments: Well I finally got into my room at Marina Bay Sands. It’s very nice,  but for some reason, the check-in process took forever. I arrived at the hotel at 1:15am, after a long flight, and didn’t get my room key until after 2am. Not a great way to start off my stay. Based on how slowly the line moved, it seems that others had the same problem.
label: Negative

Comments: Staying at the hotel, or rather swimming in the infinity pool was one of the items on my boyfriend's bucket list. It quickly became mine as well. We arrived quite late and the lady at the reception offered us a later check out (12 instead of 11), which was very nice of her. She also offered us an upgrade which, needless to say, we were over the moon about. The room was very spacious and modern. The view over the bay was simply stunning especially at night and at the sunrise. The infinity pool was fantastic, exactly what we expected. The pool doesn't get too busy. We were only able to use it after 7 pm and between 6 am and 8 am and it wasn't as crowded as you would expect it to be. The hotel also has sauna and gym. There is separate sauna for males and females. Even though there…
label: Positive

Comments: Wifey and I stayed for a night in a 46th floor deluxe room overlooking the Marina Bay and beautiful view of the city. Check-in counter lady asked us the purpose of our stay and I said for our 23rd wedding anniversary. The room was large, clean and comfortable. Free wifi connection speed was reasonable. The kind-size mattress was just firm enough and the pillows not too soft. Later that evening, we had dinner at Rise. The variety of food was amazing, one of the best buffet restaurants we've ever patronized. When we returned to the room, we were pleasantly surprised to find a superdelicious chocolate cake with Happy Anniversary waiting for us. Kudos to the staff for the wonderful touch. Fitness aficionados must try the Banyan Tree Fitness Centre on level 55 of Tower 2. The vista…
label: Positive

Comments: This huge hotel is iconic and hence draws many travellers to Singapore. We found it to be overpriced and overcrowded. The iconic swimming pool on the roof is a nice experience but security is overbearing and the staff unhelpful. There are better places to stay in Singapore.
label: Neutral

Comments: Stayed 2 nights in tower 3 level 6 - disappointing in may ways room had a strange smell and as I had a family 2 adults and 2 kids the room has 2 large ish single beds, so it was an uncomfortable night night sleeping with my boys as it wasn’t even a double bed, you get a better sized bed at Novotel for God’s sake, tv didn’t work properly, shower head sprayed everywhere....and a view of the road, make sure you get a room above at least level 10 otherwise save your cash. Then we moved to tower 1 level 27 better room but same beds, ok then....This is my third time staying here and the hotel has gone backwards in the years I have come here, service is still great but generally the place is looking tired as per photo attached, just drab. The pool is still amazing, wooden floor needs…
label: Negative

Comments: We spent a couple of days here at Marina Bay Sands in our holiday in Singapore. It was a very pleasent stay. The most thing that I like was their attention to the client. They care about any single detail and they were there before to know that you need them. The infinity pool was very nice but as we expected ...wery noisy and crowded. The skypatk it was nice also...very nice pictures from there:) The room was very clean, well maintained, comfortable and it looks pretty good.
label: Positive

Comments: One major complaint. Engaged MBS’s valet service for Thursday & Friday. Checked out on Saturday at about 12.30pm. As the valet guy handed us our key, he said something in a very fast speed but we just took the key, said our thanks and left.  It was only when we were about to get out of the car at a food centre which is 10 mins away from MBS, that my husband made sense of what that valet guy had said – that he (my husband) needed to open the door from the OUTSIDE. This meant that the door could no longer be opened from the inside! We went out on the Friday evening before and sure as hell everything worked as normal before we passed it on to the valet for the night. So we returned back to the hotel and spoke to a few of the valet guys who were on duty. The impression they gave was…
label: Negative

Comments: This place is expensive but omg the view is awesome from the room. The room was amazing but the best part was the view from the room. The pool was great but it was kind of disappointing with it being so shallow. This is a famous hotel in Singapore and everyone has so many great reviews over this place but I must say that for the price its king of average.
label: Positive

Comments: While the hotel has high standards, it was an incredibly unfriendly unpersonalised hotel. After staying in boutique hotels with friendly staff and a personalised stay, this was a disappointment. From the mass check in counters, and no-one to help with luggage on arrival, to the extortionate rate for food/drink/breakfast, I was not entirely overwhelmed as other people. The room was clean and comfortable but did not exude luxury. The bathroom was large and had a good shower. We had a view overlooking the tree forest etc which was pretty especially at night.  As a guest of course you can go to the pool and sky deck. The infinity pool was great and did give good views. There is access to the marina bay complex for shopping and food. It is about a 20-25 minute walk to the merlion.
label: Neutral

Comments: Let me get my negative point out of the way first. Expensive!!! And not sure why on tripadvisor it is ranked number 36. Was expecting it to be better. I guess the advantage of paying that much is the access to the facilities. Examples are  1). The longest infinity pool in the world which you can only access if you are staying there. You get a great view of the city in the background. 2). Access to the observation deck for free where you can also get a magnificent view of the city and the gardens by the bay. 3). If you have a room where you have a view of the Marina like I did you get to enjoy the light and fountain show from your room and many other benefits of staying there.  Also one morning while enjoying in the jacuzzi we were asked if wanted breakfast, it was brought to us…
label: Positive

Comments: The first impression of marina bay sands will definitely take your breath away just from its sheer grandiose infrastructure. The basic services of the hotel are decent enough, nothing much to say about it. Yet after 2 days I realised that the ambience of the area is not much different from a market with the excessive crowds of non-guests wandering around the venue, which diminishes extremely the luxury-comfort of this well-known 5 star hotel. Staying at marina bay sands 1 time is enough for me just for the experience, but I will probably not come back again. Though there is a decent casino if anyone is into that, and the MasterCard theatre for broadway shows touring in Singapore of course.
label: Positive

Comments: The building is very impressive to look at and the views from the pool areas are unparalleled. Unfortunately we were looking for a true 5 star hotel and in reality this is more of a 5 star Las Vegas style resort. Huge shopping mall, celebrity chef style restaurants, casino and various loud, busy bars with “doormen stamping wrists” left us slightly underwhelmed.  Room was pretty good but at £250 lacked a real wow!   If you’re looking for a beautiful hotel with an elegant lobby bar etc this wouldn’t be for you.  Glad to have seen it though.
label: Neutral

Comments: I stay in Sands form the 23rd to 26th November in room 2412. They send me a survey link and I try to fill it up on 2nd Dec and after I fill up they mention the link is expire.....??.  The hotel location is very good, it is facing the sea and garden by the bay. The view is fantastic. The service of the hotel is also good. The best about this hotel is the view plus the housekeeping is very attentive. We have been drinking tea in the first day and the housekeeper Wang XIng replenish the tea bags and put extra bags for us. He also put extra bottle of water for us to boiled.The service is really great. The biggest set back about this hotel is the shower. The have the worst shower head that u ever find in any 4 or 5 star hotel. I have stayed in many hotels groups and this is the…
label: Positive

Comments: We were really in awe seeing the Singapore Skyline. It was my first time in Sg but i never expected it to be so clean and so good. LOL. We will definitely be back here soon and stay at MBS. Food are great plus the casino and shops are big. Too many people staying at this hotel but all thanks to the people we interacted with that made me feel like I was home. 👍
label: Positive

Comments: Was here on business for 3 days and boy, it was one spectacular property. Enough options to not make you want to leave the hotel. The infinity pool, mall, food court et al, was fabulous. Great staff and views of the marina from the balcony were the highlight of the tour.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed here during our Singapore holiday and enjoyed the club room and the infinity pool very much. The room is spacious with great view even though the decor is a bit dated. Pool is crowed but our little girl loved it so much we stayed from early afternoon to 10pm most nights. The food options at the pool is limited and buffet breakfast at level 55 is very average.
label: Positive

Comments: Truly outstanding. This destination resort is so big and comprehensive you can arrive and never need to venture out as there is absolutely everything you need in one magnificent spot. Service is provided by wonderful caring staff who go above and beyond in every way. Food offer is extensive and the best of everything. Can't wait to return.
label: Positive

Comments: A once in a lifetime experience this hotel. 57 stories high, 3 towers, pool on the top with a terace. A must see and a must do. Especially at night the scenery is superb. Rooms are great. Everything is there. Attached to exhibition center. Many restaurants in and around the hotel. Bring your creditcard. It is not cheap, but you only live once. Put it on your bucket list.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands Hotel is divided into 3 towers, which offers views of the city or Gardens by the Bay (GBTB). The hotel is linked to The Shoppes and Convention Halls, and GBTB is just a link bridge away. Nearest MRT station (aka subway) is Bayfront.
label: Positive

Comments: By unpersonal approach I mean that hotel is so huge and occupied that you r hving feeling that you r checking in to a good deal hotel in the middle Of shopping centre... It is majestic but for a 400 €/night without breqkfast you should get more.  Even though, only hotel guests are allowed to a legendary roof top infinity pool, its totaly crowded, in the morning or evening or in rain...always! As well as to get a (good) table in rooftop restaurant is difficult... Food and drinks in hotel are very expensive. The music bar is cool with a great ambience but again totaly crowded...no chance to get even a stand by table... Rooms are amazing, i have no complaint abt that...luxury, comfy..and the view is spectacular... Would not visit it again...not worth the money...
label: Positive

Comments: Have not been to Singapore in over 7 years so wanted to experience the newer and very famous Marina Bay Sands. Maybe due to the casino and convention areas I really felt like I was in Las Vegas. Mix of convention attendees, families, couples and tours. Besides the early morning everything and everywhere is bustling and crowded. If you want kind of a overwhelming resort/casino experience this is the place to be.   Our suite was huge and kept very clean. Staff at whatever breakfast venue we choose were amazing.   The main attraction is the infinity pool which for me was a major disappointment. Did not utilize at all. Always crowded with most taking selfies in and out of the water. Water in the pool itself was cloudy. Just walking around was difficult due to the amount of people…
label: Neutral

Comments: What a hotel, stayed for 4 days this place is amazing. From the minute you walk in its 5* service. Had a garden room with amazing views, room was large with a balcony. There are 3 restaurants for breakfast 1 of them on the roof. We found "adrift" to be the best smaller and more personal than others with better choice of food. The pool is awesome also on the roof is a bar/night club CÉ LA VI LAVO Italian bar & restaurant Spago by Wolfgang Puck. We ate at LAVO,( had a lovely steak)  And also at spago its more sharing bit (ribs sliders)  There is a casino and an amazing shopping centre attached to the hotel with some great bars and restaurants.  Had lunch at bread street(Gordon Ramsey)  Of a night there is a water and lazer show on marina Bay itself.  My only complaint.... We…
label: Positive

Comments: I booked for a room for my birthday celebration. Upon arriving, the checkin/check out are was so crowded, because it was common area where people transfer from malls and other nearby places. Long que for checking in ,but they gave a small cornetto ice cream and water. The front desk officer greeted me a happy birthday,but nothing special or letter on the room like other hotels do. We arrived 2pm and the standard check in time is 3pm, so they gave us a temporary access to pool and bar at 57th floor, and they will just send an email once room is available and they have done it. I can say that the room is typical like 3-4 star hotel set up. Far from my expectation. We decided to went up at infinity pool which is our main purpose of stay, but unfortunately the weather is bad and…
label: Negative

Comments: Whether viewing the bay on foot or from one of the bay cruise boats it’s truly an amazing accomplishment.  Massive buildings, Gardens in the air with all the Fullerton Hotel and all the sky scrappers looking inwards its an experience not to forget.
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands as a hotel didn’t stand out to be anything special from a hotel perspective, on par with most other 5 star hotels around the world. The best thing about it as expected was the pool experience. It’s worth staying here and the premium just for that, incredible and well worth it! It does get very busy, although we noticed that people are mainly there for a photo and leave. As well as the pool, there are also some Jacuzzi’s which are not as well known about, providing the same experience facing the Gardens By The Bay. This was impressive. Pool is open late too (11pm).
label: Neutral

Comments: We stayed for 1 night in this amazing hotel in a club room during the week of the Grand Prix. What can I say it was fabulous right down to the cream tea,  drinks and canapes. The room was beautiful and we overlooked the amazing city and directly in front of the light show which we watched from our very own lounge seating area. The hotel staff were fabulous but the most impressive was the young lady who spoke to my husband using his surname after only 1 visit to the club room dining/lounge area (Thank you so much as this made our stay so personal. The infinity pool although busy was an experience we will never forget, it's open till 11 at night so you get to view the skyline in the evening - Amazing. Fantastic Stay and absolutely loved it. Ended our holiday with a bang. Thank you…
label: Positive

Comments: We just stayed at this hotel. We booked an upgraded room to take full advantage of the perks such as Club55 and the higher level rooms. We ended up staying in the orchard suite which offered the most amazing views and was huge for the two of us. If you’re booking this hotel thinking you are going to be getting the best room in Singapore, you’re deluded and I personally think it’s unfair to rate this hotel just on the room. I imagine there are much nicer rooms on offer in singapore but a hotel on this scale is never going to be able to offer the best rooms due to the sheer upkeep on the whole hotel, you book this place for so many more reasons other than a hotel room. In our opinion the whole hotel makes up for not having the most plush room to rest your head or the service…
label: Positive

Comments: If you want to stay at an iconic hotel in Singapore this is the only place to stay. Yes it's incredibly busy with 2500 rooms, plus additional visitors to the restaurants, roof top pool and shopping complex but despite all that the service is fast friendly and efficient so much so you never seem to que for anything, well other then check in!. We stayed in a suite which was large well equipped with fantastic views overs the gardens and sea. Yes it feels big busy and like an airport when you first step in but get past that and the MBS lives up to its 5star billing. It's pricey but defiantly worth the price, and you must try the pool!
label: Positive

Comments: Marina Bay Sands or MBS and we started calling it was located in the perfect spot to see most of what Singapore has to offer on foot. Metro (MTR) is underneath and easily accessible to almost anywhere including the airport. The rooms were great and most importantly quiet.
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the hotel during our recent trip to Singapore. The room was for two guests, including breakfast. However, the hotel argued that both of us have to have our breakfast at the conference (I was attending a conference next door) notwithstanding the fact that my friend is not participating in the conference, which does not make any sense to me. After much arguing, the guy at check out removed the breakfast charge, which I thought that was the end of it.  But no ... sadly, the hotel sneakily afterwards charged my credit card for the breakfast!   Generally, despite being housed within the iconic structure, sadly, there's nothing iconic about the hotel or the offering. Three star offering, at best, but desperately wanting to portray a five-star image!  I have done a lot of…
label: Neutral

Comments: 2 outstanding things about this hotel are a) pool at the top b) the area in which it is located There is a pool at the top of the 3 towers. You can spend hours in the pool. Fantastic. Singapore is not cold nor windy, so you can enter the pool even late in the evenings. The gardens next to the hotel are called “Gardens by the way”. It’s huge. There are domes built inside. You have to pay to enter the domes but nothing much inside. In the evenings there is a light show here.  This hotel is definitely worth a stay
label: Positive

Comments: We booked for a table of four for lunch at 12.30noon but was told restaurant was fully booked and had to come in by 11.30am.We had to rush there  We were there and ordered fish and chips and salmon grilled.  The food was exceptionally slow in coming until we asked the waiter to look into it. And we could have come even after 12.30as the food did not make any appearance till much latet When the fish came, it was very disappointing as the crust was thick not not light enough. The fish wasn't sweet and the chips were slightly soggy. It was a great disappionmnet as we had been there before and the fish and chips were very good.  There was nothing much to comment on the salmon and the grilled prawns as it was ordinary and nothing to rave about. The restaurant is perpetually crowded…
label: Neutral

Comments: This hotel fulfilled my expectations 100% I definitely would love to go back!  From the room we had an angel view from both sides, the breakfast at the restaurant was high quality and the snacks for the evening with drinks where pretty good!  The stuff we're very friendly and the last day the let us use the gym to take a shower, they have a pool in the gym so make sure to bring your bathing suite.
label: Positive

Comments: What can I say other than AMAZING HOTEL. The hotel room was fantastic with brilliant views of Gardens by the Bay. The staff are so helpful, nothing is too much for them. Even down to the towel decorations!! The beds are an absolute dream to sleep in and the facilities are just the best. The infinity pool was incredible. I can´t think of anywhere else to have celebrated my husbands 50th birthday other than here!!
label: Positive

Comments: excellent for one night stay, you know, bucket list 😊 Overpriced and overcrowded, too many people, not enough luxury. We had “upgraded “ room with no seat for a guest, no shaving kits, and you don’t want to see what is going on behind ( very outdated) tv , seriously, clean it , at least once a year. Very strange rules for the mini bar, drank one can of coke, charged for four and pineapple juice, which I didn’t even see. Stuff is nice and efficient, view and pool amazing. Not coming back though, checked ✅
label: Neutral

Comments: Stayed here a couple of times on business and private trips to Singapore over the past years. The reason for choosing MBS is always the same: It's amazing skyline views from the room and from the rooftop lounge!  If you are staying for business, the hotel is also in close proximity to all major financial and commercial hubs.  The only flaw that I encountered during my trips is the relatively low level of personalised service for Asian standards. Due to the high popularity and number of guests check in and check out can feel like a mass processing.
label: Neutral

Comments: Convenient location for our family as we have a 2 year old toddler, they have an overpass that connects the hotel to gardens by the bay which is great to visit at any time of the day. We stayed 2 nights, very professional service by the hotel staff, fast check-in/check-out. Even though the lobby is busy you don't get the feeling of it being overcrowded, the staff handle it well. The rooms are really spacious, clean and a joy to stay in and infinity pool was worth the visit and not overcrowded, just beautiful views! Even though the hotel is undoubtedly very expensive, if you have the money, don't hold back! Give it a go, at least for one night! From the shopping centre that connects to the hotel, to the casino, to the convenience of the MRT below and for the proximity of the…
label: Positive

Comments: We stayed at the Marina Bay Sands in November this year. This place is amazing and should be on everyone's bucket list. We were o the 48 th floor in Tower 2, the views from the room over the Singapore were spectacular. the room was luxurious and extremely comfortable as was the bed. The shower room was huge and it had a separate bath.  There is an espresso machine in the room and bottled water is provided daily. The infinity swimming pool on the 55th floor provides you with the best views in all of Singapore. The only issue is that the pool is only 1.2 metres deep and is always crowded with people constantly taking selfies, still worth a look and a refreshing escape form the humidity of Singapore. We also paid extra for access to club 55 , which is on daily from 5.00 - 7.00 pm…
label: Positive

Comments: We booked a grand club room and loved it. We had a amazing Singapore city view as well as access to club 55 which had a delicious breakfast as well as snacks throughout the day. This hotel is know for the views. We have friends that live in Singapore and without knowing where we were staying they all booked restaurants at the marina bay sands for the view. Luckily we had the same view as the restaurants from our bed. The infinity pool is definitely worth a visit and was not overly crowded even though it was great pool weather. The downstairs of the hotel has a great cocktail lounge. I cannot remember the name but the cocktails are the best I have had. If you want to shop, the attached mall has every designer you could ever imagine and a whole wing of High end designer children’s…
label: Positive
